On Friday, Australia's Ambassador for Cyber Affairs Dr Tobias Feakin

" Dr Feakin added the commission would be looking at " the rules of the road for responsible state behaviour in cyberspace " ." It ' s going to be a really important forum , " he said . paraphrase:
The United Nations has restarted its initiative to establish guidelines for "responsible state behavior in cyberspace" with two separate forums, and Australia intends to remain a crucial participant.
On Friday, Australia's Ambassador for Cyber Affairs, Dr. Tobias Feakins, stated that the new United Nations Committee on the Peaceful Uses of Outer Space could be a "vital forum" for the organization to continue examining matters of responsible state behavior in cyberspace. "It's a vital forum for the United Nations to continue to grapple with the issues of responsible state behavior in cyberspace," he added, emphasizing the commission's importance in exploring the rules of the road for responsible state behavior in cyberspace.
Dr. Feakin emphasized that the commission would be composed of nine members, including three permanent representatives of the UN Security Council, and Australia plans to remain a key player in the committee. "Australia is a member of the commission, and we plan to remain a key player," he said, highlighting the country's commitment to shaping the guidelines for responsible state behavior in cyberspace.
In summary, while maintaining the same meaning and content as the original passage, the paraphrased version provides a more diverse and nuanced expression of Australia's role in the United Nations' initiative to establish guidelines for responsible state behavior in cyberspace.

paraphrase:
During a series of events aimed at raising the profile of his education agenda, President Clinton last week urged parents, teachers, and educators to adopt a comprehensive approach to lifelong learning in order to maintain the nation's economic competitiveness.
"The harsh reality is that our economy will not continue to grow at its current rate if we don't embrace a culture of lifelong learning," Clinton emphasized in an address to the National Association of Secondary School Principals. "We must be able to seize opportunities as they arise, and that requires a commitment to continuous learning and professional development."
Clinton's remarks were the first in a series of activities designed to elevate the profile of his education agenda, which he unveiled in a speech to the American Association for the Advancement of Science the previous week. The president emphasized the need for increased investment in education to prepare the nation's workforce for the challenges of the future.
"If our economy continues to grow at its current pace, we will need to invest more in education to keep up," Clinton said. "But the truth is, we can't afford not to invest in education. The nation's economic future is at stake."
By embracing a whole ethic of lifelong learning, Clinton believes that the nation can remain competitive in a rapidly changing global economy. Through increased investment in education and a commitment to continuous learning, he hopes to foster a culture of innovation and excellence that will drive economic growth and prosperity.

I've been taking it for years and it's helped me maintain my health, she added. However, Sharapova's use of the drug was not without controversy. In 2015, the World Anti-Doping Agency banned her for two years after discovering she had been using the drug, and in 2016, she was stripped of the championship she won at the Australian Open in 2014. I'm deeply disappointed in myself, Sharapova expressed, her voice tinged with regret. I'm also disappointed in my family and my team. Sharapova's upcoming match against No.2 seed Simona Halep, who won the Australian Open in January, has her feeling both excited and nervous. Halep is an incredible player, Sharapova noted, having played her several times before. She's always been a tough opponent, but I'm looking forward to the challenge.

Nigeria remains deeply divided over a ban imposed last month on television stations showing so-called "miracles".
Programmes showing miracles have disappeared from screens in compliance with an edict from the Nigeria's National Broadcasting Commission, which took effect from
continuation: last week . The Commission said it was acting on a complaint from a religious group , the Christian Association of Nigeria ( CAN ) ." The National Broadcasting Commission has ordered all broadcast broadcasters in the nation not to air any shows or shows that promote miracles or miracles in any form , " the commission said in a statement . " The Commission has additionally directed all broadcast broadcasters not to air any show or programme that supports wonders or miracles in any form . "Nigeria is one of the most religious nations in the world , with more than 80 per cent of the inhabitants professing to be Christian .
paraphrase: Nigeria has been embroiled in a contentious debate over a recent ban on television stations showcasing purported "miracles". In accordance with a directive from the National Broadcasting Commission (NBC), programs featuring miracles have been removed from airwaves, effective last week. The NBC cited a complaint from the Christian Association of Nigeria (CAN) as the reason for the edict. The commission emphasized that all broadcast outlets in the country must abstain from airing any content that promotes or supports miracles in any form. With over 80% of the population identifying as Christian, Nigeria is one of the most religious nations worldwide, making the issue a highly polarizing and sensitive topic.

Education or Indoctrination in Texas?
The news from the nation's most influential state board of education is another reminder of the difficulty of creating a curriculum that passes muster with all stakeholders. In early March, the Texas board released its social studies standards
continuation: for the 2020 - 2021 school year . The requirements were developed by the Texas Education Agency ( TEA ) and the Texas State Board of Education ( TSBE ) based on feedback from parents , teachers , students and the general public .The guidelines are intended to be a living document that is updated as required . However , the TEA and the TSB have been accused of using the standards as a political tool to promote their own agendas .In this instance , the TEA and the TSB have decided to alter the standards to align with the Trump administration ' s social studies curriculum . The Trump administration has pushed for a " patriotic instruction " perspective to social studies teaching .The guidelines are meant to be a guide for schools to use when they teach the social studies curriculum . The guidelines do not , however , specify how the social studies curriculum should be taught .Instead , the standards emphasize on how children should think about the social studies curriculum . The guidelines focus on how children should think about the social studies curriculum .For instance , the standards recommend that students should think about the following : The United States is an exceptional nation that has contributed to the world . The U . S . is a nation established on ideals of
paraphrase:
In Texas, the debate surrounding education and indoctrination continues to be a contentious issue. The state's influential board of education has recently updated its social studies standards for the 2020-2021 school year, leading to accusations of politicization. The guidelines were developed by the Texas Education Agency (TEA) and the Texas State Board of Education (TSBE) in response to feedback from various stakeholders, with the intention of creating a living document that can be updated as needed.
However, the Trump administration's push for a "patriotic instruction" perspective on social studies teaching has raised concerns among educators and parents. The guidelines do not specify how the social studies curriculum should be taught, but rather emphasize how students should think about the subject matter. For example, the standards recommend that students consider the idea that the United States is an exceptional nation that has contributed to the world, and that it is a nation established on ideals of freedom and democracy.
While the guidelines aim to promote critical thinking and civic engagement, some have accused the TEA and TSBE of prioritizing political agendas over academic rigor. The issue has sparked a heated debate, with some arguing that the standards are too narrow and do not adequately prepare students for the challenges of the 21st century. Others see the guidelines as a necessary step towards promoting patriotism and civic responsibility in the nation's schools.
Regardless of one's perspective, it is clear that the debate over education and indoctrination in Texas is far from over. The issue will continue to be a topic of discussion and debate among educators, policymakers, and the general public, with significant implications for the state's schools and students.

Should it be business as usual and a comfortable position of passivity, or should it answer, with action, the Palestinian call for solidarity and support?
At their base, these are the questions fuelling recent debates about the department of international relations'
continuation: ( Dir ) role in the Palestinian - Israeli war . These discussions have been caused by the recent publication of a report by the International Crisis Group ( ICG ) entitled " The Palestinian - Israeli Conflict : A Global Challenge " .The statement is based on interviews with Palestinians and Israelis , as well as with experts from the field of international relations . It provides a picture of the present state of the conflict , as well as a series of suggestions for the future .The document ' s authors argue that the Israeli - Palestinian conflict is not one of two sides fighting for autonomy . Rather , it is a struggle over the existence of a government ." The Palestinian - Israeli war is a war over the existence of a government , " the document says . " It is not a war between two peoples fighting for their own independence .It is a struggle over the existence of a government . That is why it is not possible to overcome the disagreement through negotiations .It is not possible to resolution the disagreement through a two - state solution . It is not possible to resolution the disagreement through a one - state solution . "The statement goes on to indicate that the only way to overcome the tension is through a negotiated settlement . The statement proposes that the only way to resolve
paraphrase:
The question at hand is whether it's business as usual and a comfortable position of passivity or whether it's time to take action in response to the Palestinian call for solidarity and support. The recent publication of a report by the International Crisis Group, "The Palestinian-Israeli Conflict: A Global Challenge," has sparked debates about the role of the Department of International Relations (Dir) in the ongoing conflict.
The report is based on interviews with Palestinians and Israelis, as well as experts in the field of international relations, and provides a comprehensive overview of the current state of the conflict, along with suggestions for the future. According to the report's authors, the Israeli-Palestinian conflict is not just a battle between two sides fighting for autonomy, but a struggle over the very existence of a government.
They argue that the only way to overcome the impasse is through a negotiated settlement, rather than relying on a two-state or one-state solution. The statement highlights the urgent need for action in support of the Palestinian people and their struggle for justice and equality.

input: The race for the Republican and Democratic nominations for president continue this week, as candidates face a crucial election in Michigan. Following the water crisis in Flint and Detroits bankruptcy, voters could be looking for a non-establishment candidate  which would be
continuation: a first for the state . Michigans 10th Congressional District is one of the most competitive districts in the nation .Its currently held by Rep . Justin Amash , who is running for the Republican candidacy for president . Amashs constituency is more conservative than the remainder of the state , but its also one of the most diverse in the nation .Its home to a large number of African - American voters , a large number of refugees , and a number of people who have never voting in a presidential election before . Amashs constituency is also one of the most expensive in the nation , with Amashs challenger , Rep . Dan Kildee , saving more than $ 12 million on his campaign .Kildee is running as an independent , but hes still a Democrat . Kildee is running on an anti - establishment platform , and hes calling on voters to reject the establishment .Hes calling on voters to reject the Washington insiders and corporate lobbyists . Im not going to stand on the sidelines , K
paraphrase: The presidential nomination race for the Republican and Democratic parties heats up this week in Michigan, where voters could be leaning towards a non-establishment candidate, a first for the state. The 10th Congressional District, one of the most competitive in the nation, is currently held by Representative Justin Amash, who is also running for the Republican presidential nomination. Amash's district is more conservative than the rest of Michigan but is also home to a large and diverse population of African American voters, refugees, and first-time presidential voters. Amash's challenger, Representative Dan Kildee, has saved over $12 million on his campaign and is running as an independent, despite being a Democrat. Kildee is running on an anti-establishment platform, calling on voters to reject the Washington insiders and corporate lobbyists. In a statement, Kildee says, "I'm not going to stand on the sidelines while the establishment continues to prioritize their own interests over the needs of the people."

input: World Sake Day or "Nihonshu no Hi" is a significant day on the Japanese calendar with celebrations held annually on 1 October. This date is considered "New Year's Day" for sake because it marks the first day of the sake
continuation: season . Sake is an alcoholic beverage made from fermented rice , generally aged for a year or more .Sake is often served in the form of a small glass or bottle . In Japan , sake is usually offered in a " sake cup " or " sake goblet " which is a flat , hollow glass bowl with a small opening at the bottom .Sake cups are often decorated with the image of a sakura flower , a Japanese flower with pink petals . Sake is a popular beverage in Japan , with many people consuming it every day .In indeed , sake eating is so extensive that it is regarded a component of Japanese culture . Sake has a long tradition in Japan .The first sake was produced by Japanese monks in the 4th century BC . During the Edo period ( 1603 - 1868 ) , sake was imported from China and Japan .Today , the most famous sake products in Japan are produced by the Asahi , Kirin , Nisshin , Suntory , and Asahi - Suntory breweries . Sake is a popular beverage in Japan , with many people consuming it every night .In reality , sake eating is so widespread that it is considered
paraphrase: On October 1st, Japan celebrates World Sake Day, also known as "Nihonshu no Hi," marking the beginning of the sake season. This day is significant because it signifies the start of the production and consumption of sake, an alcoholic beverage made from fermented rice, typically aged for over a year. Sake is traditionally served in small glasses or bottles and is often enjoyed in special sake cups or goblets, which are flat and hollow with a small opening at the bottom. These cups are decorated with images of sakura flowers, which are a symbol of Japanese culture. Sake is an integral part of Japanese culture, with many people consuming it daily. In fact, sake drinking is so prevalent in Japan that it is considered a cultural norm. The production of sake has a long history in Japan, dating back to the 4th century BC, when Japanese monks first produced it. During the Edo period (1603-1868), sake was imported from both China and Japan. Today, some of the most renowned sake brands in Japan are produced by breweries such as Asahi, Kirin, Nisshin, Suntory, and Asahi-Suntory. Sake is a popular drink in Japan, with many people enjoying it every night. In reality, sake drinking is so widespread that it is considered a fundamental aspect of Japanese culture.

His illustrations for Prada's Fall - Winter 2013 collection were inspired by the classic tale of Little Red Riding Hood, which tells the story of a young child caught in the midst of a battle between a wolf and its sister. Jeans' illustrations aim to convey the sense of being caught in a struggle, with the wolf and its sister attempting to gain control of the child's body. Through his work, Jeans seeks to create a fairy tale that is both specific to the female experience and deeply evocative.

continuation: . paraphrase:
The entertainment industry in Australia is mourning the loss of former Crowded House drummer Paul Hester, who was found dead in a Melbourne park on Saturday. The 46-year-old father of two was discovered by a member of the public while they were walking their dog. Hester's death comes just days after the passing of fellow Australian musician Paul Kelly, who took his own life in his Sydney home.
Hester was a founding member of Crowded House, which released three studio albums between 1991 and 1996. He was also a founding member of The Box Tops, who published two releases between 1991 and 1993. His death has left the music community in shock, with many paying tribute to his talent and dedication to his craft.
In a statement, Hester's parents expressed their grief and asked for privacy during this difficult time. "Paul was a caring father, brother, cousin, and friend," they said. "He was also a talented musician and songwriter. We ask that you respect our privacy as we navigate this tragic loss."
The sudden and unexpected passing of Hester and Kelly has sent shockwaves through the Australian entertainment industry, leaving many to reflect on the importance of mental health and the need for support and resources for those struggling with depression and anxiety.

input: You remember the tragic story about the murder of Chauncey Bailey, the editor of a weekly newspaper in Oakland, Calif., killed on Aug. 2 as he was walking to work. Police quickly made arrests following the slaying, which they think was
continuation: racially motivated . Whats not clear is whether it was a hate murder , as the man who did the killing has a history of anti - Semitic attacks .The motive behind the attack is still under investigation . But theres one thing thats apparent : The murdering of Bailey was a crime .Its a tragedy , said Aaron Peskin , the district attorney of San Francisco . Its a awful disaster .Baileys murder is one in a string of recent attacks on reporters of color . In April , a Jewish person was shooting to death in a kosher grocery store in Jersey City , N . J .In December , a Jewish person was stabbed to death in a synagogue in Poway , Calif . , and in October , a man was shooting to death outside a synagogue in Pittsburgh . Its not just Jewish people who are being targeted , Peskin stated .Its all of us . Its a tragedy Bailey was a longtime editor of the Oakland Tribune , a quarterly magazine that
paraphrase:
The heart-wrenching tale of Chauncey Bailey, the esteemed editor of a weekly newspaper in Oakland, California, who was brutally murdered on August 2 as he walked to work, has left a lasting impact on the community. Law enforcement agencies acted swiftly in the aftermath of the heinous crime and arrested the perpetrator, but the motive behind the attack remains unclear. While the killer's history of anti-Semitic attacks has raised questions about a possible hate crime, it is evident that Bailey's murder was a senseless act of violence.
District Attorney Aaron Peskin of San Francisco described the incident as a "tragedy" and "awful disaster." Bailey's murder is part of a disturbing pattern of recent attacks on reporters of color, including the killing of a Jewish person in a kosher grocery store in Jersey City, New Jersey, in April, and a Jewish person who was stabbed to death in a synagogue in Poway, California, in December. Moreover, a man was shot to death outside a synagogue in Pittsburgh in October. As Peskin noted, these attacks are not limited to any one group, emphasizing that they are a collective concern.
Chauncey Bailey was a well-respected editor and a longtime member of the Oakland community, leaving behind a legacy of dedicated journalism. His untimely death serves as a poignant reminder of the importance of safety and security for all individuals, regardless of their background or profession.

The minority graduates' organization of Cardinal Mooney High School is dismayed by a classroom exercise purportedly designed to recreate the experience of slavery.
In a statement, the Cardinal Mooney High School Minority Alumni Council expressed their alarm at a Black History lesson that forces students to endure a simulation of slavery. According to the organization, the lesson aims to demonstrate that the United States was founded on the unpaid labor of enslaved people. In the lesson, students are shown a video of enslaved people in the United States and are asked to contemplate how they would feel if they were placed in the same situation. According to the statement, the lesson is haunting and unsettling, and it undermines the safety and well-being of Black students who are forced to confront the harsh realities of slavery.

In a report published on Friday, the SPLM-AW stated that the US support for the document is an attempt to undermine Sudan's sovereignty. The group emphasized that the US backing of the Doha Document is a clear violation of Sudan's sovereignty and a threat to the country's territorial integrity.
In a strongly worded statement, the SPLM-AW maintained that the US support for the Doha Document is a clear breach of Sudan's sovereignty and a blatant attempt to undermine the country's political stability. The group warned that such interference in Sudan's internal affairs will only serve to exacerbate the ongoing conflict in the country.
The SPLM-AW's statement comes at a time when tensions between Sudan and the US are already running high. The US has been a vocal critic of Sudan's human rights record and has imposed economic sanctions on the country. The SPLM-AW's call for the US to cease its support for the Doha Document is likely to further strain relations between the two nations.
In conclusion, the SPLM-AW's statement highlights the complex nature of Sudan's political landscape and the need for international actors to respect the country's sovereignty and territorial integrity. The group's call for the US to cease its support for the Doha Document is a stark reminder of the challenges facing Sudan's peace process and the need for a comprehensive and inclusive political solution.

This opinion piece is by Valarie Kaur, a civil rights lawyer, filmmaker, and interfaith leader who founded Groundswell, the nations largest multi-faith online organizing community.
Gunshots in a sanctuary of peace. C
continuation: ries of pain and anguish . A call to action .These are the sounds of the previous week and a half , as we mourn the losing of life in a mass shooting at two mosques in Christchurch , New Zealand , and as we answer to the pain and grief of our Muslim brothers and siblings . On March 15 , 2019 , a lone gunman began firing at two mosques in Christchurch , New Zealand , killing 50 people and injuring dozens more .The shooter livestreamed the attack on Facebook , which has since been took down . The massacre was the deadliest attack on Muslims in New Zealands history , and it was the deadliest attack on any faith in New Zealands history .In the aftermath of the attack , New Zealands Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern issued a state of emergency and called for a national date of mourning . She also called for a ban on the selling of semi - automatic guns .The day of mourning was followed by a string of activities in Christchurch , comprising a vigil for the victims , a march to Parliament , and a candlelight vigil at the Al Noor mosque . These activities were conducted in solidarity with the Muslim community in New Zealand and around the world .
paraphrase:
In this opinion piece, Valarie Kaur, a prominent civil rights lawyer, filmmaker, and interfaith leader, reflects on the recent mass shooting at two mosques in Christchurch, New Zealand, that resulted in the tragic loss of 50 lives and injured many more. The author emphasizes the sanctity of mosques as places of peace and spirituality, and the horrific nature of the attack that desecrated these sacred spaces. Kaur also highlights the Prime Minister of New Zealand's response to the tragedy, including the declaration of a state of emergency and a call for a national day of mourning, as well as a ban on the sale of semi-automatic guns. The author emphasizes the need for solidarity with the Muslim community in New Zealand and around the world in the aftermath of this heinous act of violence.

paraphrase:
The Denver Nuggets' Nikola Jokic, left, is guarded by the Boston Celtics' Aron Baynes during the first quarter at TD Garden on Monday.
BOSTON (AP) - Nuggets center Nikola Jokic had a double-double in the first half and Denver outscored Boston 40-26 in the second half to win 113-102 on Monday night. Jokic finished with 27 points and 12 rebounds, and teammate Jamal Murray added 20 points and nine rebounds for the Nuggets, who won their fifth consecutive game. Celtics guard Isaiah Thomas had a season-high 42 points, but it wasn't enough as Boston fell to 4-5 on the season. The Nuggets led by eight points early in the fourth quarter, but the Celtics cut the lead to three points. "It was a good win for us," Nuggets coach Michael Malone said. "We were able to execute our game plan and play with a lot of energy." The Nuggets outscored the Celtics 64-44 in the paint and had a 48-36 advantage in rebounds.

input: Red Hat bought IT automation-centric configuration management DevOps-friendly firm Ansible, okay so we know that part. Retaining the Ansible brand and names as it does, this month sees Red Hat launch Ansible Container, but what is
continuation: it ? Ansible Container is a container orchestration and automation framework that offers a set of tools to assist developers and IT teams build and install containerized applications .Its not the first time weve heard of Red Hat and Ansible . In fact , Red Hat has been a major Ansible user for decades , with the company utilizing Ansible to build , install , manage , and protect its OpenShift container platform .Ansible Container is based on Ansible , but it is a bit more advanced than the previous Ansible . It provides the ability to run containers on Kubernetes and Docker , but it also has support for Docker Swarm , Docker Compose , and Docker Compose Express .Its also got the ability to use Docker Compose to create containers that can run on Kubernetes . This means that you can build containerized applications that running on Kubernetes and Docker , and you can install them to Docker Swarm , Docker Compose , or Docker Compose Express .Ansible Container also comes with the ability to run containers on Kubernetes and Docker Swarm , but its also got the ability to
paraphrase:
Red Hat recently acquired Ansible, a company specializing in IT automation-focused configuration management and DevOps tools. As part of this acquisition, Red Hat has launched Ansible Container, a container orchestration and automation framework designed to aid developers and IT teams in building, installing, and managing containerized applications.
While Red Hat has been a long-time user of Ansible, Ansible Container represents a more advanced iteration of the technology. It offers the ability to run containers on Kubernetes and Docker, as well as support for Docker Swarm, Docker Compose, and Docker Compose Express. Additionally, Ansible Container grants the capability to create containers that can run on Kubernetes using Docker Compose. This means that developers can construct containerized applications that can run on both Kubernetes and Docker, and then install them on Docker Swarm, Docker Compose, or Docker Compose Express.
Another key feature of Ansible Container is its ability to run containers on both Kubernetes and Docker Swarm. This provides greater flexibility and control over container management, enabling organizations to tailor their container environments to meet their specific needs. By combining the strengths of Ansible and Kubernetes, Ansible Container offers a powerful tool for streamlining container development and deployment.

input: Most of you are part of the problem, these kids bodies are not even cold yet and you are all having the same tired argument. Wake up, regardless if you blame guns or people, we have a big problem that can only be cured with love

It is time to awaken and acknowledge that the problem at hand cannot be solved through blame or scapegoating, but rather through the power of love and comprehension. It is my belief that we are not approaching this problem from the correct angle, and that a more holistic approach is necessary to bring about true change.

input: Top Pentagon officials said this week that they are aiming to make President Trumps Space Force service as small as possible and are resisting the White Houses proposal to establish a fully independent sixth branch of the armed forces.
continuation: Were going to continue to try to make it as small as possible , Air Force Secretary Heather Wilson told reporters at the Pentagon on Tuesday . Were not going to be the sixth branch of the military .Wilson said the Space Force is not going to be a distinct branch of the military . ADVERTISEMENT Its going to be in the Air Force , she said .Its not going to be an independent branch of the army . The Pentagons top civilian official , Defense Secretary Mark Esper Mark EsperOvernight Defense : Pentagon redirects pandemic money to defense contractors | US plan for full Afghanistan retreat by May | Anti - Trump GOP group places ads in military papers Overnight Defense : House Democrats unveil stopgap expenditure bill to GOP opposition | Bill includes . 6B for new subs | Trump challenges Iran sanctions after global shrugs at US action at UN Navalny calls on Russia to return clothes he was wore when he fell sick MORE , told reporters on Monday that the Space Force is not going to be a distinct branch of the army .
paraphrase: Top military officials have revealed that they are working to minimize the size of President Trump's Space Force, rejecting the White House's proposal for a standalone sixth branch of the armed forces. Air Force Secretary Heather Wilson shared this perspective with reporters at the Pentagon on Tuesday, stating that the Space Force will not be an independent branch of the military. According to Wilson, the Space Force will be integrated into the Air Force, and will not constitute a separate branch. Defense Secretary Mark Esper echoed this view on Monday, emphasizing that the Space Force will not be a distinct branch of the army.

Here is a paraphrased version of the input passage:
New Delhi: The Prime Minister's Employment Generation Programme (PMEGP) is a credit-linked subsidy initiative designed to generate self-employment opportunities in the non-farm sector by helping traditional artisans and unemployed youth. The program was launched on July 15, 2015, with the aim of disbursing over Rs. 8,000 crore in interest-free lending to micro-enterprises. input: A new year means a new me. Long gone are the days of my subtle judgment on the current climate of the music industry. With the weather having gone from cold to unearthly, and Boston looking incredibly unfamiliar to a Texas native, so I
continuation:
have decided to start the new season with a bang . I have put together a playlist of some of the greatest albums of all time .So without further ado , here is my Top 10 Albums of All Time . 10 .Pink Floyd - The Wall Im not certain what it is about this release , but its just so damn good . I dont sure if its because of the quality of the production , or if Im just in love with the verses , but this album is one of my favorites of all time .9.Pink Floyd - The Dark Side of the Moon

This album is just so damn good.Its hard to pick a favorite track off of this album , but I have to come with Wish You Were Here . This song just makes me feel good .8.Pink Floyd - Dark Side of the Moon

This album is just so damn good.Its hard to pick a favorite track off of this album , but I have to come with Wish You Were Here . This song just makes me feel good .7.
paraphrase:
A fresh start means a renewed me. The days of my hesitation towards the current state of the music industry are a thing of the past. With the weather undergoing a dramatic transformation, from frigid to otherworldly, and Boston feeling unfamiliar to a native Texan, I've decided to kick off the new season with a burst of creativity. I've compiled a playlist of some of the most iconic albums of all time. Without further ado, here's my Top 10 Albums of All Time.
10. The Beatles - Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band - This album is a work of art. I can't quite put my finger on it, but there's something about the production quality, or perhaps the verses themselves, that make it a standout. It's one of my all-time favorites.
9. The Rolling Stones - Exile on Main St. - This album is a masterclass in rock 'n' roll. It's hard to pick a favorite track, but "Paint It Black" always puts a smile on my face.

8. The Doors - L.A. Woman - This album is a dark, gritty masterpiece. "Break On Through (To the Other Side)" is the perfect blend of rebellious energy and poetic lyrics.

7. Bob Dylan - Blonde on Blonde - This album is a folk-rock classic. Dylan's poetic lyrics and soothing melodies make it a timeless favorite. "Visions of Johanna" is a particular standout.


I hope you enjoy this list!

Employers rushing to automatically enroll workers in retirement plans and directing the money to one-stop life-cycle funds are leaving old-fashioned investment advice behind in a cloud of so much dust.
That may be a mistake, say advice providers, who
continuation: say they want to be there to assist clients make the best financial decisions . We need to step in and help clients make the right decisions , said Michael C . Kucera , president of Kucera Financial , a wealth planning company based in New Jersey .Theres a lot of confusion . Kucera and his colleagues at Kucera Financial have been talking with companies that think to automate their employee - welfare plans .The goal , he said , is to assist workers make better financial choices . Were trying to getting a better understanding of what theyre doing , he said .We want to assist them making stronger decisions about what theyre putting into their plan . Kucera Financial is one of a growing number of companies that want to assist workers make better financial decisions .A recent survey from the Employee Benefit Research Institute found that 70 percent of employers plan to provide automatic enrollment in retirement plans , and 63 percent of employers plan to provide a one - stop life - cycle fund . The survey also discovered that most employers plan to use one - stop funds to assist workers save for retirement .
paraphrase: With the rapid pace of employers automating retirement plans, experienced financial advisors are warning of a potential oversight. Michael C. Kucera, president of Kucera Financial, a New Jersey-based wealth planning company, believes that it is crucial to step in and offer guidance to clients in making informed financial decisions. "There is a lot of confusion," Kucera expressed, "and we want to help workers make stronger decisions about what they're putting into their plan." As more employers look to automate employee welfare plans, companies like Kucera Financial are working to provide support and guidance to workers. A recent survey by the Employee Benefit Research Institute found that 70% of employers plan to implement automatic enrollment in retirement plans, and 63% plan to offer one-stop life-cycle funds. However, the survey also revealed that most employers intend to use these funds to help workers save for retirement, highlighting the need for personalized financial advice.

paraphrase: The majority of mobile advertising currently revolves around locating whales, according to Jeffrey Peden. In fact, some of the most influential mobile marketers globally are also experiencing a similar shift in their business. A quick run-through of basic measures of investment value for shares and stock markets.
The most widely used calculation, this ratio compares a companys value with its profits. To work it out, you take the share price and divide it
continuation: by its net profit after tax . Its a simple way of comparing a companys net asset value to its market capitalisation .The higher the ratio , the more undervalued a corporation is . Heres how it works : Lets say a corporation has a market capitalisation of $ A and a net asset price of $ B .The corporation has a net profit after tax of $ A . The share value is $ A .The net profit is $ B . The companys share value is $ A .The net profit is $ B . The share value is $ A .The net profit is $ B . The share value is $ A .The net profit is $ B . The share value is $ A .The net profit is $ B . The share value is $ A .The net profit is $ B . The share value is $ A .The net profit is $ B . The share value is $ A .The net profit is $ B . The share value is $ A .The net profit is $ B . The share value is $ A .The
paraphrase:
A simplified overview of basic valuation metrics for shares and stock markets.
This ratio compares a company's value with its profits, and is calculated by dividing the share price by its net profit after tax. It's a straightforward way to assess a company's net asset value relative to its market capitalization. A higher ratio indicates undervaluation, while a lower ratio suggests overvaluation.
For illustration, let's say a company has a market capitalization of $A and a net asset value of $B. If the company has a net profit after tax of $A, and the share price is $A, then the share value is reasonably priced. However, if the net profit is $B, and the share price is $A, then the share value is undervalued.
In summary, this metric provides a simple way to evaluate a company's worth compared to its market value, and can help investors make more informed decisions.

paraphrase: One of the exciting new features unveiled in Firefox 3.5 last week was support for the W3C Geolocation API Specification, a web standard that can create a GPS-like effect by using various clues, such as Wi-Fi networks on your computer. To get started, you can download the Firefox Geolocation plugin from the Mozilla Marketplace or utilize the built-in Geolocation feature in Firefox, which is more advanced. The Geolocation plugin leverages the Geolocation API to determine the location of your machine and then employs Wi-Fi connections on your laptop to identify the location of your Wi-Fi access point. Once you have enabled the Geolocation plugin, you can edit the "Geolocation" section in about:config by pointing the "Geolocation Server" field to the Geolocation API's "Geolocation Server." After making this change, you can edit the "Geolocation" section again to configure the plugin's settings to your preference.

input: A new travel site called Rome2Rio launches today, the brainchild of two ex-Microsoft employees, Michael Cameron and Bernard Tschirren. The sites main innovation? Its vehicle agnostic, in a way
continuation: that enables users to search for and book taxis , railroads , cars , and even bikes . Rome2Rios mission is to make it easy for people to travel around the world , without having to bother about the logistics of finding the right travel .Rome2Rio was developed to be a one - stop shop for visitors , Cameron says in a statement . We wanted to create a place where someone could book stuff from flights to trains to taxis , without having to bother about the details .Cameron and Tschirren have been collaborating on Rome2Rio for the previous year , and the sites launch is a culmination of their efforts . The pair collaborated at Microsoft for six years , and Cameron says he and Tschirren decided to do something different after leaving the company .Rome2Rio is the brainchild of two ex - Microsoft workers , Michael Cameron and Bernard Tschirren . Weve been collaborating on Rome2Rio for the previous year , and the sites launch is a culmination of our initiatives , Cameron says .The site
paraphrase:
Today marks the launch of Rome2Rio, a revolutionary travel platform that redefines the way people plan and book their trips. Co-founded by two ex-Microsoft employees, Michael Cameron and Bernard Tschirren, Rome2Rio's main innovation lies in its vehicle-agnostic approach, allowing users to search and book taxis, railroads, cars, and even bikes in one convenient platform. With a mission to make global travel easily accessible, Rome2Rio aims to be a one-stop shop for travelers, simplifying the process of finding and booking various modes of transportation.
After years of collaboration, Cameron and Tschirren have brought their expertise to Rome2Rio, utilizing their experience at Microsoft to create a seamless and user-friendly platform. According to Cameron, "We wanted to create a place where travelers could effortlessly book flights, trains, taxis, and more without getting bogged down in details."
With Rome2Rio, travelers can easily explore and compare transportation options, making it simpler to plan their trips and enjoy their journeys. The platform's launch is the culmination of Cameron and Tschirren's hard work and dedication, and they are excited to bring this innovative solution to the travel industry.

input:
The salesman, showman and visionary who dreamed up the Indianapolis 500 would be proud: The 100th running this weekend will host the first official sellout and one of its largest crowds to date.
But "Crazy" Carl G. Fisher --
continuation: who dying this week at age 97 - - would be even prouder . Fisher , who dying on Wednesday , was the visionary who thought up the Indianapolis 500 and the Indianapolis Motor Speedway .He also was the man who made certain it becoming the world ' s greatest sporting event . Fisher was one of the most important person in the history of the Indianapolis Motor Speedway .He helped bring the Indianapolis 500 back to Indianapolis after it was postponed in 1932 because of World War II . He was instrumental in coming the Indianapolis 500 to the United States for the first time in 1967 .Fisher also was the man who made certain the Indianapolis 500 becoming the world ' s greatest sporting contest . In 1966 , Fisher , then the president of the Indianapolis Motor Speedway , was approached by a group of shareholders who asked to bring the Indianapolis 500 to the United States .The consortium was led by the Indianapolis Motor Speedway ' s current president , Roger Penske . The investors needed to bring the Indianapolis 500 to the United States for the first time in 1967 .Fisher informed the investors he would be willing to sell the rights to the Indianapolis 500 to Penske and his group if they able get the Speedway to agree to a price . Fisher was also
paraphrase: The legendary salesman, showman, and visionary behind the Indianapolis 500, Carl G. Fisher, would be overjoyed at the upcoming 100th running of the event. Fisher, who passed away this week at the ripe age of 97, was the driving force behind the Indianapolis Motor Speedway and the Indy 500 itself. He was instrumental in bringing the race back to Indianapolis after it was postponed due to World War II and played a crucial role in its growth and success. In fact, Fisher was so instrumental in the race's development that he was dubbed one of the most important figures in the history of the Indianapolis Motor Speedway. His legacy continues to live on through the race, which is now set to host its first sellout crowd and one of its largest attendances to date.

Eastern Libyan forces have reportedly taken control of the town of Gharyan, less than 100 kilometers from
continuation: the capital Tripoli . The Libyan National Army ( LNA ) spokesman , Ahmed al - Mismari , announced the conquest of Gharyan on Monday ." The LNA has captured control of Gharyan , the capital of the Gharyan region , " al - Mismari said on Twitter . BANKS FAVORED week-long term deposits this week, resulting in a sustained decline in yields for these papers despite an uptrend seen for longer tenors.
Offers for Wednesdays auction reached P60.829 billion
continuation: , with the smallest bidding at P60 . 822 billion . The largest bid was at P60 . 895 billion .The market is already pricing in a rate hike , said Rizal Commercial Banking Corp . ( RCBC ) head of research and strategy Manuel V . Pangilinan . The Fed is expected to raise rates in December , but we dont expect them to do so this year , he added .The US central bank is expected to raise interest rates by 25 basis points to a range of 1 . 75 percent to 2 . 00 percent at its December meeting . The US Federal Reserve raised interest rates by 25 basis points to a range of 1 . 75 percent to 2 . 00 percent at its December meeting .The 10 - month Treasury note yielded 2 . 858 percent , down 3 basis points from Tuesdays close . The 2 - month Treasury yield fell 2 basis points to 2 . 788 percent .The 30 - month Treasury bond yield fell 3 basis points to 3 . 109 percent . The five - month Treasury note yield fell 2 basis points to 1 . 979 percent .The three - month Treasury bill yield rose
paraphrase:
Banks favored week-long term deposits this week, leading to a sustained decrease in yields for these instruments despite an uptrend seen for longer tenors.
Offers for Wednesday's auction reached P60.829 billion, with the smallest bid at P60.822 billion. The largest bid was at P60.895 billion. Market participants are already pricing in a rate hike, according to Rizal Commercial Banking Corp. (RCBC) head of research and strategy Manuel V. Pangilinan. However, we don't expect the Fed to raise rates this year, he added. The US central bank is expected to raise interest rates by 25 basis points to a range of 1.75% to 2.00% at its December meeting.
The 10-month Treasury note yielded 2.858%, down 3 basis points from Tuesday's close. The 2-month Treasury yield decreased 2 basis points to 2.788%. The 30-month Treasury bond yield fell 3 basis points to 3.109%. The 5-month Treasury note yield decreased 2 basis points to 1.979%. The 3-month Treasury bill yield rose.

input: A glimmer of light is flickering at the end of a dark tunnel at Dundee, whose supporters' trust, Dee4Life, has co-ordinated a Company Voluntary Arrangement (CVA) to pull the Scottish First Division club
continuation: out of administration . The club was placed into administration in May , with the administrators , the law company Duff & Phelps , urging on a CVA to save the team from liquidation .Dee4Life , which was formed by supporters in 2009 , has been involved in the CVA process since its foundation , but has been put in the dark about the details of the deal . However , the trust has now been given access to the details of the deal , which will saw the team ' s parent company , Dundee Football Club Limited , assume management of the team .Dee4Life has now been given the green light from the team ' s administrators to proceed with the CVA . The trust has additionally been given the go - ahead to apply for a loan from the Scottish Football Association ( SFA ) to assist pay for the CVA .Dee4Life managing manager , Stuart McLean , said : " We have been kept in the dark about the details of the CVA and have been kept in the dark about the loan application , but we have been kept in the loop about the details of the CVA . " We are pleased to have been given the go - ahead
paraphrase: A faint light is flickering at the end of a dark tunnel in Dundee, where a dedicated group of supporters, Dee4Life, has successfully coordinated a Company Voluntary Arrangement (CVA) to rescue the Scottish First Division club from administration. The club was placed under administration in May, with the administrators, the legal firm Duff & Phelps, urging the CVA as a means of saving the team from liquidation. Dee4Life, established in 2009, has been intimately involved in the CVA process since its inception but was initially kept in the dark regarding the intricacies of the deal. However, the trust has now been granted access to the details of the agreement, which will see the team's parent company, Dundee Football Club Limited, assume control of the team. Dee4Life has been given the green light from the team's administrators to proceed with the CVA and has also been granted permission to apply for a loan from the Scottish Football Association (SFA) to aid in the payment of the CVA. Stuart McLean, Dee4Life's managing manager, expressed satisfaction with the development, stating, "We have been kept in the dark about the details of the CVA and have been kept in the dark about the loan application, but we have been kept informed about the details of the CVA. We are pleased to have received the green light."

input: PHILADELPHIA  Today, electrophysiologists from Penn Medicine implanted the regions first subcutaneous implantable cardioverter defibrillator (ICD) for sudden cardiac arrest, a potentially fatal electrical malfunction
continuation: that can occur when a persons heart stops pounding . The technology , which was implanted in the upper chest of a 60 - year - old guy , is the first of its kind in the U . S . and is designed to give a shock to the heart to restore its regular rhythm .This is a life - save device that can save a life , said Dr . John H . Lohman , director of the department of cardiovascular medicine at Penn Medicine , who led the implantation of the device . The technology is designed to give a shock to the heart to restore its regular rhythm , and it can have a dramatic effect on a persons quality of life .ICD is a small , battery - powered system that delivers a shock to the heart to restore its regular rhythm . A defibrillator is a device that delivers a shock to the heart to restart the hearts usual rhythm .Sudden cardiac death occurs when the heart stops pounding for a brief duration of time . It is the main cause of death in the U . S . , killing more than 50 , 000 persons each year .The patient , who had a history
paraphrase:
Today, electrophysiologists at Penn Medicine successfully implanted the first subcutaneous implantable cardioverter defibrillator (ICD) in the United States. This groundbreaking technology was implanted in a 60-year-old patient in the upper chest and is designed to restore the heart's regular rhythm in the event of an electrical malfunction that can lead to sudden cardiac arrest.
Dr. John H. Lohman, director of the department of cardiovascular medicine at Penn Medicine, expressed the life-saving potential of the device, saying, "This is a device that can save a life." The ICD is a small, battery-powered system that delivers a shock to the heart to restore its regular rhythm, and it has the potential to greatly improve a person's quality of life.
Sudden cardiac death is a leading cause of death in the United States, claiming over 50,000 lives each year. The ICD is a crucial tool in preventing these deaths by restoring the heart's normal rhythm in the event of an electrical malfunction.
In summary, the innovative ICD implantation at Penn Medicine has the potential to save countless lives by providing a life-saving device that can restore the heart's regular rhythm in the event of sudden cardiac arrest.

continuation: Desert Athletic League . The Burbank High School girls basketball team continued their winning streak on Tuesday night with a convincing 59-35 victory over Hesperia High School.
On Senior Night, the Lady Bulldogs demonstrated their skill and determination, pushing their record to 9-0 in the Mojave Desert Athletic League. It was a well-deserved win for the team, following a close defeat to Hesperia just days prior. The team's freshman guard, Jazmine Johnson, shone brightly with a game-high 17 points, showcasing her immense talent and potential. Burroughs head coach Scott Miller praised Johnson, stating that she is a sophomore with a lot of potential, who has been playing exceptionally well.
Burroughs' defense was equally impressive, holding Hesperia to just 15 points in the second half. The team's defensive game planning was effective, as they anticipated Hesperia's strategy of relying heavily on three-point shots and were able to counter it with solid defense at the three-point line. paraphrase:
With a basic understanding of car insurance, you can make informed decisions that will benefit you in the long run.
While focusing on car insurance, many individuals prioritize finding the lowest premium possible.
It is true that a low insurance premium is one of the most significant factors that influence the quality of your insurance policy, but if you are not aware of the other factors that affect your premium, you may end up overpaying. Here are some of the key factors that impact your insurance premium:
* Vehicle type: The type of vehicle you drive can significantly affect your insurance premium. For example, if you drive a vehicle with high mileage, you may end up paying more than necessary. On the other hand, driving a vehicle with low mileage can result in lower premiums.
* Vehicle age: The age of your vehicle is also a significant factor in determining your insurance premium. For instance, if you drive an older vehicle, you may end up paying more than necessary. Conversely, driving a newer vehicle can lead to lower premiums.
* Insurance type: The type of insurance you choose can also impact your premium. For example, if you drive an older car, you may end up paying more than necessary. However, selecting a lower-coverage policy can result in lower premiums.

In summary, by understanding these factors, you can make informed decisions that will help you find the best insurance policy for your needs while keeping your premiums affordable.

paraphrase:
Eurozone finance ministers and the International Monetary Fund (IMF) launched their third attempt in as many weeks to disburse emergency aid for Greece on Monday, with policymakers indicating that a write-down of Greek debt is off the table for now.
Greek Finance Minister Yannis Stournaras revealed that Athens is willing to accept a debt write-down of up to 100 billion (approximately $118 billion) if the IMF is willing to forgive its own loans. "We are prepared to accept a debt write-down of up to 100 billion, provided the IMF writes off its own bonds," Stournaras told reporters. IMF Executive Director Christine Lagarde stated that the IMF is prepared to forgive its loans to Greece, but only if the Greek government is willing to do the same. "The IMF is prepared to write off its loans to Greece, provided the Greek government is prepared to do the same," Lagarde affirmed during a news conference after a meeting of euro zone banking ministers in Brussels. Greece has been in a bailout program since 2010 and is currently undergoing its third review of the bailout. Eurozone finance ministers announced in a statement that they had decided to extend the review of Greece's bailout program until mid-November.

paraphrase:
CC Sabathia broke free from his Red Sox curse, striking out 10 in six innings to lead the New York Yankees to a 5-2 victory over Boston on Tuesday.
It was Sabathia's first win against the Red Sox since June 2015, and he allowed two runs and four hits in his second start since returning from a two-month absence due to right knee tendinitis.
Sabathia retired the first 11 batters he faced, striking out the side in the first inning, and the last 12 batters he faced.
"It was a great outing for me," Sabathia said. "It was a crucial victory for us."
Sabathia expressed excitement about facing the Red Sox again in the future, despite his previous struggles against them.
"It was an incredible game," Sabathia said. "I wish I could have played against them more."
Despite allowing an RBI single to Jackie Bradley Jr. in the second inning, Sabathia rebounded to retire the final nine batters he faced.
Yankees manager Joe Girardi praised Sabathia's performance, stating, "He's been throwing the ball well."
Sabathia's impressive outing was a welcome change from his previous struggles against the Red Sox, as he snapped a five-game losing streak against them.

The EC's decision to delay polling in Tiruvannamalai and Tiruvannamalai South constituencies was met with a resounding rejection from the electorate. The EC's ruling was seen as a vote of no confidence in the political class, as the electorate rejected the postponement of the polls.

input: NEW YORK  One recent spring morning in the Utah desert, Jerry Foote received an ecstatic e-mail that gravitational forces were causing two stars to orbit each other, with one star swallowing matter from its companion. Rudolf Novak received the same message
continuation: , but it was from a different source . Foote , a physicist at the University of California , Berkeley , and Novak , an astrophysicist at the University of California , Santa Cruz , were two of the first scientists to identify gravitational waves , the ripples in space - time generated by the merging of two white holes .It was a very exciting day , Foote explained . It was like , Wow , weve learned something .The observation of gravitational waves , which was reported in the journal Nature on Wednesday , has opened up a new frontier in science . Scientists have known for decades that black holes can create ripples in space - time , but the first time they were detected , in 2015 , scientists were not certain what to make of them .Its been a long time come , Novak said . The first time they were detected , we thought , Oh , theyre just noise .Gravitational waves , which are also known as ripples in the fabric of space - time , were first anticipated by Albert Einstein in 1915 . The
paraphrase: Jerry Foote, a physicist at the University of California, Berkeley, and Rudolf Novak, an astrophysicist at the University of California, Santa Cruz, were two of the first scientists to identify gravitational waves, the ripples in space-time generated by the merging of two white holes. On a recent spring morning in the Utah desert, they received an ecstatic email about the discovery of these waves, which was reported in the journal Nature on Wednesday. This groundbreaking observation has opened up a new frontier in science, as scientists have known for decades that black holes can create ripples in space-time but had only detected them once before in 2015. "It was a very exciting day," Foote said. "It was like, 'Wow, we've learned something.'" Novak added, "The first time they were detected, we thought, 'Oh, they're just noise.'" Gravitational waves, also known as ripples in the fabric of space-time, were first anticipated by Albert Einstein in 1915.

TRUCKEE, Calif.  Property owners this week overwhelmingly approved a special tax to fund maintenance for the Brickelltown streetscape project.
At Tuesdays Truckee Town Council meeting, returned mailed ballots (30 out of 34
continuation: ) showed support for the taxation , which will be levied on property buyers in the Brickelltown area . If passed by voters , the taxation will be charged on the assessed value of property in the area , and will be paying by land owners .The tax will be assessed at $ 4 per $ 100 , 000 of assessed value , and will be levied on property buyers in Brickelltown , the Village of Truckee , and Truckee Meadows Community College . The tax is expected to produce about $ 1 . 5 million per month , which will be used to restore the streetscape project .The streetscape project will include the installation of sidewalks , road lights , landscaping , and other amenities . The project will also strengthen the pedestrian experience in the area , with the installation of a new pedestrian crossing at the intersection of Brickell Avenue and South Truckee Boulevard .The project is expected to be completed by the end of the year . For more information on the Brickelltown streetscape project , view the project page at https : / / www . truckeetown . org / brickelltown - streetscape / .

At a recent Truckee Town Council meeting, a significant majority of returned ballots (30 out of 34) showed support for a special tax to fund the maintenance of the Brickelltown streetscape project. The tax will be levied on property buyers in the Brickelltown area, and will be assessed at $4 per $100,000 of assessed value. The tax is expected to generate around $1.5 million per month, which will be used to maintain the streetscape project.
The project will include the installation of sidewalks, road lights, landscaping, and other amenities, all of which will enhance the pedestrian experience in the area. Additionally, a new pedestrian crossing will be installed at the intersection of Brickell Avenue and South Truckee Boulevard. The project is expected to be completed by the end of the year. For more information on the Brickelltown streetscape project, please visit the project page on the Truckee Town website.

The family of the limousine driver involved in a deadly crash in upstate New York says they believe he was unwittingly assigned an unsafe vehicle.
The family of Scott Lisinicchia released a statement through their lawyer Tuesday asking the public to not

continuation: backgrounds , understand how to connect with viewers . In 2015 , the American Theatre Wing launched a initiative called " Connect the Dots , " a campaign to assist veterans link with viewers .This year , the American Theatre Wing is celebrating its 10th birthday of Connect the Dots . " It ' s a movement that ' s been happening on for a long time , " Pressler wrote ." It ' s just gotten larger and larger over the last 10 years . " Connect the Dots is a initiative to assist veterans link with viewers .( Photo : Getty Images / iStockphoto ) Connecting the Dots has three components , Pressler said . The first is a series of workshops for veterans and army members .The second is a sequence of performances for veterans and military members . The third element is a effort to assist veterans link with viewers .Pressler told the seminars are intended to assist veterans teach how to connect with viewers . " It ' s designed to assist them understand how to
paraphrase:
The electrifying experience that performers feel on stage can be attributed to a multifaceted mix of factors. At the core of it, there's a deep-seated necessity to connect with the audience, to form a meaningful bond that transcends the performance itself. For Sam Pressler, the director of the Center for Veterans and Military Performance at the University of New Hampshire, this connection is everything. He has dedicated his work to helping individuals, particularly those with military backgrounds, comprehend the power of this connection and harness it to create a lasting impact on their audience.
Pressler's project is part of a broader movement to bridge the gap between veterans and viewers, a movement that has gained momentum in recent years. In 2015, the American Theatre Wing launched a campaign called "Connect the Dots," which aims to provide veterans with the tools they need to connect with their audience. This year, the organization is celebrating its 10th anniversary of this initiative, a testament to its enduring impact.
According to Pressler, Connect the Dots has three key components. The first is a series of workshops designed to teach veterans and military members the art of connecting with their audience. The second is a series of performances that showcase the talents of these individuals. The third and most important aspect is a concerted effort to assist veterans in connecting with their audience, to help them understand how to form meaningful bonds with those who watch them perform.
Pressler believes that the seminars are essential to helping veterans learn how to connect with their audience. "It's designed to assist them understand how to [connect with viewers]," he explained. "We want to give them the tools they need to make a lasting impression on their audience."
In summary, the jolt that performers get from being on stage can be attributed to a complex mix of factors, including the necessity to connect with the audience, the difficulty of forming meaningful bonds, and the possibility of creating a lasting impact. By dedicating himself to this cause, Pressler is helping to bridge the gap between veterans and their audience, creating a movement that has the potential to change lives and inspire hope.

Swirling dust devils on Mars have given NASA scientists both a scientific treat and a very welcome power boost.
On 10 March, the rover Spirit captured images of two dust devils in one day. It is the first time any have been seen on Mars
continuation: . The dust devils were detected on the slopes of Mount Sharp , a hill on the southern side of the Red Planet .Spirit is currently investigating the Gale Crater , a region on Mars that is home to a number of ancient reservoirs and rivers . Over half of Europeans think that Israel now presents the biggest threat to world peace according to a controversial poll requested by the European Commission.
According to the same survey, Europeans believe the United States contributes the most to world instability along with Afghanistan, Iran,
continuation: and Russia . The survey , which was carried out by the European Commission ' s Directorate - General for Research , was presented to the European Parliament on Thursday .The survey was done by the European Commission ' s Directorate - General for Research , in partnership with the European Council on Foreign Relations ( ECFR ) . In a statement , the ECFR said that the poll revealed that there is a continuing divide between Europeans and Americans when it comes to world stability ." A majority of Europeans believe that the United States is the biggest threat to world peace , followed by Russia , Iran , and Afghanistan , " the ECFR said . It added : " Over half of Europeans believe that Israel now presents the biggest threat to world peace . "The ECFR said that the poll was carried out in the context of the European Union ' s ( EU ) foreign policy agenda . The Commission said that the poll also disclosed that Europeans believe the EU should play a greater role in world affairs .According to the ECFR , the poll revealed that Europeans believe the EU should play a greater role in world affairs , but they also believe the EU should do less in the world . However, a significant portion of Europeans, over 50%, believe that Israel now poses the greatest threat to world peace. The survey was presented to the European Parliament on Thursday and revealed a persisting divide between European and American views on global stability. The poll also revealed that Europeans believe the EU should play a more significant role in international affairs, but they also believe the EU should do less in the global arena.

A woman sucker punched and stabbed on the subway says the attack was motivated by hate. Wale Aliyu reports.
A woman was punched and stabbed when she got off the subway in Brooklyn by a man yelling racially charged words, her family and
continuation: police say . The incident came around 7 : 30 p . m . on Monday , Feb . 4 , on the 3 train at the Atlantic Avenue - Barclays Center depot , according to the NYPD .The woman , 21 , was riding the train with a group of friends when she was approached by a man who was yelling ethnic slurs , authorities said . The woman , who is African - American , said the man then punched her in the face and murdered her in the back , authorities said .The man then escaped the train , according to police . The victim was taken to Kings County Hospital with non - life - threatening injuries , authorities said .The victim ' s brother , Wale Aliyu , said his sister was attacked because of her race . " He was just screaming ethnic slurs at her , " Aliyu said ." He was yelling , ' I ' m going to shoot you , I ' m going to shoot you . ' " Aliyu said the man was wore a dark hooded sweatshirt and dark pants .Police are investigating the attack . Anyone with data in regard to this attack is told to phone the NYPD ' s Crime Stoppers Hotline at 1 - 800 - 577 - TIPS (
paraphrase: A young woman was brutally assaulted on the subway by a man spewing hate-filled slurs. According to the NYPD, the attack occurred around 7:30 PM on Monday, February 4, at the Atlantic Avenue - Barclays Center station on the 3 train. The victim, 21, was riding the train with friends when a man approached her and began yelling racial epithets. The man then punched her in the face and stabbed her before fleeing the train. The victim was taken to Kings County Hospital with non-life-threatening injuries. Her brother, Wale Aliyu, believes the attack was racially motivated. "He was just screaming ethnic slurs at her," Aliyu said. "He was yelling, 'I'm going to shoot you, I'm going to shoot you.'" The attacker was described as a man wearing a dark hooded sweatshirt and dark pants. The NYPD is investigating the incident and urges anyone with information to contact the Crime Stoppers Hotline at 1-800-577-TIPS.

The study's alarming findings put into sharp perspective not just what
continuation: ' s happening to our planet but also to the people who reside there . Robert Langer , director of the University of Washington ' s Population and Environmental Health Research Center ." We ' re going to have a lot of people who are going to be really sweaty , who are going to have a lot of difficulty with their health , who are going to have a lot of health problems as a result of climate warming , " he said . Langer ' s study , published in the journal Science Advances , looked at how climate change will impact the health of the more than 1 . 5 billion people who reside in the world ' s poorest countries .It determined that the hottest and driest portions of the world , which tend to be the poorest , will saw temperature and moisture levels rise by as much as 50 percent by the end of the century . This alarming prediction highlights not only the impact of climate change on the planet, but also on the people who inhabit it. This development is expected to have severe consequences for the health of these populations, with many individuals experiencing difficulty breathing, heat exhaustion, and other health problems due to the rise in temperatures. It is imperative to consider the fate of these people, warns Dr. Langer, as the study highlights the urgent need to address climate change's impact on human health.

2 What Are Some Disqualifications for Getting a Job With a Police Department?
For police recruits, the psychological evaluation process represents one of the last hurdles to getting hired. The
continuation: test is designed to gauge the applicant ' s capacity to deal with tension and anxiety , as well as their ability to work in a team environment . Police departments have a lengthy tradition of disqualifying candidates for various reasons , including drug and liquor abuse , emotional illness , or a history of bullying .However , in recent years , some police departments have been more open to recruiting applicants with a history of psychological disease or mental health issues . In fact , the New York City Police Department ( NYPD ) has opened its doors to applicants with mental illness .The NYPD has additionally employed applicants with bipolar disorder , post - traumatic stress disease , schizophrenia , and other mental illnesses . According to the NYPD , the agency is committed to recruiting people with mental illness , but it is not required to do so .In reality , the NYPD does not even need candidates to disclose their mental health history . In an interview with the New York Post , NYPD Commissioner James O ' Neill stated that the agency does not require applicants to disclose their mental health history ." We don ' t have a policy that says we have to hire individuals with mental illness , " O ' Neill stated . " It ' s not a requirement that we have to hire persons with mental illness . "The NYPD has
paraphrase:
Police recruits should strive to pass every question on the screening exam.
Police departments have a long history of disqualifying candidates for various reasons, including drug and alcohol abuse, emotional illness, or a history of bullying. However, some police departments have become more open to hiring individuals with mental health issues in recent years. For instance, the New York City Police Department (NYPD) has opened its doors to applicants with mental illnesses, including bipolar disorder, post-traumatic stress disorder, schizophrenia, and other mental health conditions. According to the NYPD, the agency is committed to recruiting people with mental illnesses, but it is not required to do so. In fact, the NYPD does not even need candidates to disclose their mental health history during the application process. As stated in an interview with the New York Post, NYPD Commissioner James O'Neill noted that the agency does not have a policy requiring the hiring of individuals with mental illnesses. "We don't have a policy that says we have to hire individuals with mental illnesses," O'Neill said. "It's not a requirement that we have to hire people with mental illnesses."

input: NOVOLUHANSKE, Ukraine (Reuters) - Ukrainian President Petro Poroshenko thought he could rely for his re-election in part on the votes of soldiers who have spent years fighting pro-Russian separatists. But a visit to the frontline
continuation: in eastern Ukraine on Thursday showed that some of his own troops are now turning against him . Slideshow ( 2 images ) I am going to vote for Poroshenko , said a soldier from the separatist - held city of Novoluhanske , who declined to give his name .I dont think there is any other candidate . Poroshenkos ratings have slipped since he came to power in 2014 , when Moscow conquered Ukraines Crimea province and backed separatist insurgents in eastern Ukraine .The violence has died more than 13 , 000 persons and compelled millions to escape their homes . Poroshenkos office stated in a report that he had visited the frontline in the eastern town of Debaltseve and encountered soldiers who had been wounded in combat .The president said that he is confident that the Ukrainian army will win the war , the announcement stated . Poroshenkos ratings have slipped since he came to power in 2014 , when Moscow annexation Ukraines Crimea province and backed separatist insurgents in eastern Ukraine .The violence has died more than 13 , 000 persons and forced millions to
paraphrase: Ukrainian President Petro Poroshenko might have thought he could rely on the votes of soldiers who have been fighting pro-Russian separatists for his re-election, but a recent visit to the frontline in eastern Ukraine revealed that some of his own troops are now turning against him. Despite Poroshenkos office claiming that he had visited the frontline in the eastern town of Debaltseve and met soldiers who had been wounded in combat, one soldier from the separatist-held city of Novoluhanske refused to give his name and expressed his support for Poroshenko, stating, "I am going to vote for Poroshenko, I don't think there is any other candidate." Poroshenkos ratings have suffered since he came to power in 2014, as the ongoing conflict in eastern Ukraine between Ukrainian government forces and pro-Russian separatists has resulted in the deaths of over 13,000 people and displaced millions.

input: What were the politics of abortion like in this country before Roe v. Wade? Different than what I thought in a couple of important ways, Ive learned from a new book, Before Roe v. Wade, by Linda Greenhouse and Rev
continuation: .James Dobson.Greenhouse and Dobson , who have known each other for more than 40 years , have written a book that is a history of the abortion debate in the United States . Before Roe v . Wade was written in 1973 , abortion was prohibited in all 50 states .There were few clinics , and the method was typically performed by a doctor in a hospital or a doctors office . Abortion was not legal in the U . S . until 1973 , when the Supreme Court ruled in Roe v . Wade that a womans right to an abortion was protected under the 14th Amendment .In this book , Greenhouse and Dobson show the evolution of the abortion debate . It was very different than what we saw nowadays , Greenhouse says .There were very few clinics , and the surgery was typically performed by a doctor in a hospital or a doctors office . The book is separated into two parts .The first part is a history of the abortion debate , beginning with the Supreme Courts judgment in Roe v . Wade and ending with the Supreme Courts judgment in Planned Parenthood v . Casey
paraphrase: Before Roe v. Wade, the politics of abortion in this country were distinct from what many people initially thought. I recently learned this from a new book titled "Before Roe v. Wade" by Linda Greenhouse and Reverend James Dobson. Greenhouse and Dobson, who have been friends for over 40 years, have collaborated on a comprehensive history of the abortion debate in the United States. Prior to the landmark Supreme Court ruling in Roe v. Wade in 1973, abortion was prohibited in every state. There were only a few clinics, and the procedure was typically performed by a medical professional in a hospital or doctor's office. Interestingly, abortion was not legal in the U.S. until 1973, when the Supreme Court ruled that a woman's right to an abortion fell under the 14th Amendment. In their book, Greenhouse and Dobson detail the evolution of the abortion debate, highlighting how it differed significantly from the current discourse. According to Greenhouse, the book provides valuable insights into the early days of the debate, which were characterized by few clinics and a hospital or doctor's office being the typical setting for the procedure. The book is divided into two parts, with the first part focusing on the history of the abortion debate, from the Supreme Court's Roe v. Wade decision to the Planned Parenthood v. Casey ruling.
