paraphrase:
The paparazzi who were taking pictures of Princess Diana when she died in a car crash reportedly obstructed the police from reaching the scene, according to an inquest held today.
An eyewitness, Clifford Goorovadoo, testified that when the first police officers arrived, they were informed by the paparazzi that the princess had passed away. The paparazzi allegedly did not want the authorities to reach the scene because they were concerned that they would find photographs of the princess.
Mr. Goorovadoo, who was present with his wife at the time of the accident, stated that he was informed by the authorities that the queen had perished. He revealed that he was informed that the paparazzi were afraid that they would pull images of the princess if the authorities were allowed to reach the scene.
However, Mr. Goorovadoo expressed confusion and revealed that he did not understand what to do in this situation. He further added that the authorities were concerned that they would not be able to reach the scene of the accident due to the paparazzi's interference.
In summary, the paparazzi hindered the police from reaching the scene of Princess Diana's accident, and their actions caused confusion and concern among the authorities.

input: DES MOINES, Iowa (AP)  Authorities apprehended a man Wednesday suspected in the early morning killings of two Des Moines area police officers who were shot to death while sitting in their patrol cars in what authorities described as separate ambush-style attacks.
continuation: The suspect was described as De ' Von Bailey , 23 , who was seized without incident in a wooded area outside the Des Moines neighborhood of Ankeny . The suspect was being held in the Polk County Jail in Des Moines on two counts of last - degree killing and one count of attempted last - degree killing , according to the Polk County Sheriff ' s Office .Des Moines Police Sgt.Paul Parizek and Sgt.Paul Parizek were shot and murdered Tuesday morning as they sat in their patrol cars in a parking lot at the police department ' s headquarters . Sgt .Paul Parizek was shooting in the head and death at the scene . Sgt .Matthew Jones was shooting in the arm and was taken to a doctor , where he was listed in stable condition . " We ' re going to getting through this , " Des Moines Mayor Frank Cownie stated at a news conference ." We ' re going to gotten through this because we have a powerful society . We ' re going to gotten through this because we have a powerful police force .We ' re going to getting through this because we have a powerful sheriff ' s department . We ' re going to getting through this because we have a powerful prosecutor ' s office . "
paraphrase:
A suspect, De'Von Bailey, 23, was apprehended by authorities without incident in a wooded area outside the Des Moines neighborhood of Ankeny. Bailey is believed to be responsible for the early morning ambush-style killings of two Des Moines area police officers who were shot and murdered while sitting in their patrol cars. The suspect is being held in the Polk County Jail on two counts of first-degree murder and one count of attempted first-degree murder, according to the Polk County Sheriff's Office.
The victims, Des Moines Police Sgt. Paul Parizek and Sgt. Matthew Jones, were shot and killed Tuesday morning in a parking lot at the police department's headquarters. Sgt. Paul Parizek was pronounced dead at the scene, while Sgt. Matthew Jones was shot in the arm and is currently listed in stable condition.
Des Moines Mayor Frank Cownie spoke at a news conference, stating, "We will get through this, we have a strong community, a powerful police force, and a dedicated sheriff's department. We will get through this because we have a powerful prosecutor's office."

Thermal emission from erupting volcanoes on the Jupiter's moon Io. A logarithmic scale is used to classify volcanoes on the basis of thermal emission; the larger the spot, the larger the thermal emission.
A new map of
continuation: Jupiter ' s moon Io demonstrates that volcanoes on the surface of the icy planet have been erupting for millions of years , and that these eruptions are still going powerful . The new map was developed using data from NASA ' s Juno satellite , which has been orbiting Jupiter since July 2016 .The Juno expedition was built to study Jupiter ' s interior , and the new map indicates that the planet ' s volcanoes are still active . " This is the first time that we ' ve been able to see at the surface of a moon that ' s been erupting for thousands of years , " added Scott Bolton , Juno ' s chief researcher at the Southwest Research Institute in San Antonio , Texas .The new map appears that volcanoes on the surface of Io have been erupting for millions of years , and that these eruptions are still going powerful . " The thermal emitted from volcanoes on Io is very related to what we saw on Earth , " Bolton said .The new map was developed using data from NASA ' s Juno satellite , which has been orbiting Jupiter since July 2016 . The Juno flight was built to study Jupiter ' s interior , and the new map indicates that the moon ' s volcanoes are still active ."This is the first time that we've been able to look
paraphrase:
Volcanic activity on Jupiter's moon Io has been mapped using NASA's Juno satellite, revealing millions of years of eruptions on the icy surface. The new map shows that these eruptions are still powerful and ongoing. The thermal emissions from Io's volcanoes are similar to those found on Earth, indicating that the moon's interior is still active.
The study, led by Scott Bolton, Chief Researcher at the Southwest Research Institute in San Antonio, Texas, provides the first detailed look at the surface of a moon that has been erupting for thousands of years. "This is the first time we've been able to see at the surface of a moon that's been erupting for thousands of years," Bolton said.
The new map was developed using data from Juno, which has been orbiting Jupiter since July 2016. The mission was designed to study Jupiter's interior, and the new map suggests that Io's volcanoes are still active. "The thermal emissions from Io's volcanoes are very related to what we saw on Earth," Bolton added.
The discovery provides insight into the geological history of Io and its potential for hosting life. The study also highlights the importance of continued exploration of our solar system to better understand its diverse and complex geological processes.

Investing in the best ETFs in tech is a safe and simple way to make more money today.
The great thing about any exchange-traded fund (ETF) is that it affords you a lot of potential upside while also greatly divers
continuation: ifying your portfolio . ETFs are traded like securities , and they ' re intended to mimic the performance of their underlying index .For instance , the SPDR S & P 500 ETF ( NYSEARCA : SPY ) is an ETF that records the S & P 500 , and the Vanguard Total Stock Market ETF ( NYSEARCA : VTI ) is an ETF that records the total securities market . ETFs are a huge way to obtain exposure to a broad variety of companies and industries without the danger of owning individual shares .But what if you wanted to diversify your assets even further ? What if you wanted to invest in ETFs that invest in the companies that are going to be the most successful in the future ?That ' s precisely what the iShares Russell 2000 ETF ( NYSEARCA : IWM ) does . IWM records the Russell 2000 Index , which is an index of lower - cap stocks .The Russell 2000 Index is comprised of about 4 , 000 stocks , and it ' s one of the best methods to diversify your portfolio . IWM tracks the Russell 2000 Index , which is an index of lower - cap stocks .The Russell 2000 Index is comprised of about 4,000 stocks, and it's one of
paraphrase:
Investing in the most advanced ETFs in the tech sector can provide a secure and straightforward means of increasing your wealth in the present.
Exchange-traded funds (ETFs) offer a fantastic opportunity for upside potential while also significantly diversifying your portfolio. ETFs are traded like securities and are designed to mimic the performance of their underlying index. For instance, the iShares Core S&P Total U.S. Stock Market ETF (NYSEARCA: ITOT) tracks the total U.S. stock market, while the Vanguard Total International Stock ETF (NYSEARCA: VEU) tracks the total international stock market. ETFs provide an excellent way to gain exposure to a wide range of companies and industries without the risk of owning individual shares.
However, if you want to take your portfolio to the next level of diversification, you might consider investing in ETFs that focus on the companies that are expected to be the most successful in the future. The iShares PHLX Semiconductor ETF (NYSEARCA: SOXX) is an example of such an ETF, as it tracks the PHLX Semiconductor Index, which includes companies involved in the design, manufacture, and sale of semiconductors. This ETF provides exposure to a specific sector within the tech industry, giving your portfolio added diversity and potential for growth.
In conclusion, investing in top-notch ETFs in the tech sector can be a safe and straightforward way to boost your wealth in the present. By diversifying your portfolio through ETFs, you can reduce risk and increase potential returns, all while gaining exposure to a broad range of companies and industries.

input:
Hourly workers aren't the only ones who have to track hours worked.
2 What if a Salaried Employee Works More Than 40 Hours?
Ask two workers if they prefer a salary or hourly wage, you will likely get two different answers
continuation: . What is the difference between a wage and an hourly wage ?Salary is a wage that is paying to an worker on a regular basis . An hourly wage is a wage that is paying to an worker on an as - needed basis .Salary is paying on a regular basis . An hourly wage is paying on an as - needed basis .What is the difference between a wage and an hourly wage ? Salary is a wage that is paying to an worker on a regular basis .An hourly wage is a wage that is paying to an worker on an as - needed basis . Why do hourly workers get pay less than salaried labor ?The difference between a wage and an hourly wage is that an hourly worker is paying on an as - needed basis . An worker who works 40 hours a week is paying less than a salaried employee who works 40 hours a week .Why is an hourly employee paid fewer than a salaried employee ? An hourly employee is paying on an as - needed basis .An worker who works 40 hours a week is paying less than a salaried employee who works 40 hours a week . What is the difference between a wage and an hourly wage ?
paraphrase:
Salaried employees may work more than 40 hours a week, but their pay remains consistent. Hourly workers, on the other hand, are paid for the hours they work, and their pay varies depending on the number of hours they put in. While some people might prefer the stability of a salary, others might prefer the flexibility of an hourly wage.
The main difference between a wage and an hourly wage is that a wage is paid on a regular basis, while an hourly wage is paid on an as-needed basis. Salaried employees are typically paid a set amount each month, regardless of the number of hours they work, while hourly workers are paid for the time they spend working.
Hourly workers may be paid less than salaried employees because they are paid for the hours they work, rather than a set amount each month. For example, an hourly worker who works 40 hours a week will earn less than a salaried employee who works the same number of hours, but is paid a set amount each month.
In summary, the difference between a wage and an hourly wage is that a wage is paid on a regular basis, while an hourly wage is paid on an as-needed basis. Hourly workers may be paid less than salaried employees because they are paid for the hours they work, rather than a set amount each month.

KINSHASA Congolese
continuation: court rejects presidential candidate Jean - Pierre Bemba ' s appeal Bemba , who is serving a 15 - year sentence for crimes against humanity in The Hague , appealed the judgement to the Constitutional Court , which on Monday refused his petition . " The Constitutional Court of the Democratic Republic of Congo has refused the appeal of Jean - Pierre Bemba to the Constitutional Court of the Republic of Congo , " the court said in a statement .Bemba , who was once a close allies of President Joseph Kabila , has been one of the most vocal critics of Kabila ' s decision to stay in authority beyond the end of his mandate in December 2016 . paraphrase:
The Congolese Supreme Court has definitively disqualified Jean-Pierre Bemba, a prominent opposition leader, from the upcoming presidential election in December due to his conviction for witness tampering at the International Criminal Court. Bemba, who is currently serving a 15-year sentence in The Hague, had appealed the judgment to the Constitutional Court, but his petition was rejected on Monday.
According to a statement released by the court, the Constitutional Court of the Democratic Republic of Congo has refused Bemba's appeal, confirming the earlier decision to exclude him from the election. Bemba, who was once a close ally of President Joseph Kabila, has been a vocal critic of Kabila's decision to extend his mandate beyond the end of 2016. He is one of several opposition figures barred from running in the December 23 election, which is seen as a crucial test of the country's stability.
Bemba's spokesman, Jean-Jacques Muyembe, described the court's decision as "not a surprise," expressing disappointment that the Constitutional Court could not find a way to resolve the situation. Bemba's legal team had argued that the court had no jurisdiction over his case due to the International Criminal Court's lack of an arrest warrant for him.
In conclusion, the Congolese Supreme Court's decision to disqualify Jean-Pierre Bemba from the presidential election has further complicated the already tense political landscape in the Democratic Republic of Congo. The rejection of Bemba's appeal highlights the ongoing challenges faced by the country in ensuring a fair and peaceful transition of power.

Benjamin Berg, the BB of BB Lemon, knows how to create an inviting venue.
Berg hatched the great-looking B
continuation: . B . Lemon concept at the corner of West Main Street and Washington Avenue in the summer of 2014 .Berg , who has worked in the restaurant business for more than 20 decades , said he wanted to give the neighborhood a new restaurant . I wanted to bring a new restaurant to the district , he said .I wanted to bring a new concept to the area . B . B .Lemon has been open for about a year and a half and provides a variety of menu items , notably burgers , sandwiches , salads and desserts . Berg said the burgers are a signature dish at B . B .Lemon.We have a signature burger, he said.Its a simple cheeseburger.Berg said the burger is served on a bun with mayonnaise and mustard.Its a great burger , he said . paraphrase:
B.B. Lemon, a popular eatery in the area, boasts a signature dish that has won the hearts of many - the simple cheeseburger. Benjamin Berg, the mastermind behind B.B. Lemon, has a proven track record in the restaurant industry, having worked for over two decades. Berg's vision for B.B. Lemon was to bring a fresh concept to the neighborhood, and he certainly succeeded. The restaurant has been open for about 18 months now, offering a wide range of menu options, including mouth-watering burgers, sandwiches, salads, and desserts.
Berg considers the cheeseburger to be a highlight of the menu, served on a soft bun with a tangy combination of mayonnaise and mustard. According to Berg, the simplicity of the dish is what makes it so great. "It's a great burger," he said. "It's very simple, but it's something that people really enjoy."
In addition to the signature burger, B.B. Lemon offers a diverse selection of salads and sandwiches, catering to a variety of tastes and preferences. Whether you're in the mood for something classic or adventurous, there's something for everyone at this charming eatery.

A motorcyclist from Worthing suffered fatal injuries following a collision with two cars on the A286 in Birdham, near Chichester, yesterday.
The 56-year-old motorcyclist from Worthing collided with a Jaguar travelling in
continuation: the opposite direction on the A286 at around 9 . 30am . The motorcyclist was taken to hospital where he died a brief time later .His next of kin have been informed . The driver of the Jaguar , a 48 - month - old guy from Chichester , was not injured .The road was closed for several hours while emergency services dealt with the incident . A Sussex Police spokesman said : " We are appealing for anyone who seen the accident or who might have dash cam footage of the area at the time to come in touch . "Anyone with info is told to phone 101 quoting serial 549 of 16 / 02 .
paraphrase: A motorcyclist from Worthing met a tragic end after a head-on collision with two vehicles on the A286 in Birdham, near Chichester, yesterday. The 56-year-old rider suffered fatal injuries after colliding with a Jaguar traveling in the opposite direction at around 9:30 am. The motorcyclist was rushed to the hospital, where he sadly passed away shortly after. The driver of the Jaguar, a 48-year-old man from Chichester, escaped injury. The road was closed for several hours as emergency services dealt with the incident. A spokesperson for Sussex Police urged anyone who witnessed the accident or has dash cam footage of the area at the time to come forward, asking them to phone 101, quoting serial 549 of 16/02.

input: Amazon has announced another twist on the Fire TV in the form of the Fire TV Cube. If you imagine the functionality of the Fire TV, combine it with an Echo Dot and add in a bit of universal remote control, you've arrived at the Fire
continuation: TV Cube . It ' s a small device , measuring just 3 . 5 x 2 . 5 x 0 . 6 inches , and weighing in at just 5 ounces .It ' s a bit thicker than a regular Fire TV , but it doesn ' t felt like a toy . Fire TV Cube : What it is and how it works The Fire TV Cube is Amazon ' s taking on the Fire TV stick .It ' s a little bigger than the Fire TV Stick , but still smaller than the Fire TV Cube . It ' s powered by a quad - core processor , which means it ' s not as powerful as the Fire TV Stick , but it ' s more strong than the Fire TV Lite .It ' s also got a dual - band 802 . 11ac Wi - Fi chip , and a quad - core 1 . 2GHz processor . The Fire TV Cube additionally comes with a remote , which is more like a universal remote control than the Fire TV remote .It ' s got buttons for volume and playback , as well as a dedicated search button . The Fire TV Cube also comes with a built - in Wi - Fi hotspot , so you can connect up to five devices to it .Fire TV Cube: How it works
paraphrase:
Amazon has unveiled the latest iteration of their Fire TV, the Fire TV Cube, which combines the functionality of the Fire TV with the convenience of an Echo Dot and the versatility of a universal remote control. Measuring 3.5 x 2.5 x 0.6 inches and weighing only 5 ounces, the Fire TV Cube is a compact device that packs a punch in terms of performance.
While it may be slightly larger than the standard Fire TV stick, the Fire TV Cube boasts a quad-core processor that provides a smooth and seamless viewing experience. Additionally, it features a dual-band 802.11ac Wi-Fi chip and a quad-core 1.2GHz processor, making it more powerful than the Fire TV Lite.
The Fire TV Cube also comes with a remote control that is more akin to a universal remote than the standard Fire TV remote. This remote features buttons for volume and playback control, as well as a dedicated search button, making it easy to navigate your favorite content.
Another notable feature of the Fire TV Cube is its built-in Wi-Fi hotspot, which allows you to connect up to five devices to it. This means you can easily share your streaming experience with friends and family without worrying about additional devices.
Overall, the Fire TV Cube offers a unique and convenient streaming experience that combines the best of Amazon's Fire TV technology with the versatility of an Echo Dot and a universal remote control. Its compact size and powerful processor make it an ideal choice for anyone looking to upgrade their streaming setup.

input:
Gloucester claimed their second win of the season to impose a third defeat of the fledgling campaign on Wasps.
Stephen Jones put Wasps 3-0 ahead before two Freddie Burns penalties and a converted James Simpson-Daniel try gave the hosts a
continuation: bonus - point win . Wasps were in the ascendancy after a exciting opening period , but Gloucester were in control after the broke .Gloucester ' s Freddie Burns celebrates scoring his side ' s second try against Wasps ( Steven Paston / PA ) Jones ' club , who have won just one of their opening seven Premiership matches , were reduced to 14 men after just five moments when scrum - half Dan Robson was shown a yellow card for a high tackle on Wasps captain Tom Youngs . But they were still in control at the broke after Burns converted Simpson - Daniel ' s try to make it 3 - 0 .Gloucester , who have won just one of their opening seven Premiership matches , made a bright start to the second half , with Burns adding a penalty to make it 3 - 3 . But Wasps were not to be denied , with Simpson - Daniel taking a third penalty to make it 10 - 3 .Gloucester , who are now without a win in their opening seven Premiership matches , were reduced to 14 men after just five minutes when scrum - half Dan Robson was shown a yellow card for a high tackle on Wasps captain Tom Youngs ( Steven Paston / PA )
paraphrase:
Gloucester secured their second victory of the season by defeating Wasps for the third time in their opening matches.
Stephen Jones gave Wasps an early lead with a penalty, but Freddie Burns responded with two successful penalties of his own, followed by a converted try from James Simpson-Daniel, which gave the hosts a bonus point win. Wasps were in control during the opening period, but Gloucester took the lead after the break. Gloucester's Freddie Burns celebrated his side's second try against Wasps with enthusiasm (Steven Paston/PA)
Wasps were reduced to 14 men after just five minutes when scrum-half Dan Robson was shown a yellow card for a high tackle on Wasps captain Tom Youngs, but they continued to fight back, with Burns adding a penalty to make it 3-3. However, Wasps were not to be denied, with Simpson-Daniel taking a third penalty to make it 10-3. Gloucester, who have won only one of their opening seven Premiership matches, made a strong start to the second half, but their hopes were dashed when they were reduced to 14 men.

input:
Almost three weeks after a primary that wiped out two incumbents, the remaining candidates for Carroll County commissioner are struggling to show voters that they're much different from each other.
Most of the candidates mounted successful primary campaigns by saying they would not be like
continuation: their predecessors . But at least one nominee , incumbent Republican Commissioner Mark Hager , is trying to place himself as the most conservative candidate in the race ." I ' m the most conservative incumbent , " Hager said . Hager is one of three Republicans standing for the three - year term .The other two are incumbent Democrat John Fetterman and independent candidate Bob Hagan . Hager is the only one of the three candidates who has a background in government .He worked as a vice county executive for four years before he was elected to the state House of Delegates in 2014 . He ' s been working as a county commissioner since 2015 .He ran for the state House of Delegates in 2014 and lost , but he won his seat in 2016 . Hager said he ' s the most conservative candidate in the race because he believes government should be smaller ." I ' m the most conservative because I believe government should be smaller , " Hager said . " I believe we should have less government .I believe we should have less regulation . " Hager said he ' s also running because he ' s the only candidate who ' s not a politician ." I ' m not a politician , " Hager said . " I ' m not a career politician .I
paraphrase:
Three weeks after a contentious primary, the remaining candidates for Carroll County commissioner are scrambling to distinguish themselves from one another. While most contenders campaigned on promises to differ from their predecessors, incumbent Republican Commissioner Mark Hager is actively positioning himself as the most conservative option in the race.
Hager, one of three Republicans vying for the three-year term, emphasizes his government experience, having worked as a vice county executive for four years before being elected to the state House of Delegates in 2014. He has been serving as a county commissioner since 2015 and previously ran for the state House of Delegates in 2014, although he lost. Hager believes he stands out from the competition due to his belief in a smaller government and fewer regulations.
"I'm the most conservative candidate in the race because I truly believe government should be smaller," Hager said. "I believe we should have less government and less regulation. That's why I'm running, because I'm not a career politician like the other candidates." Hager is one of three Republicans in the race, along with incumbent Democrat John Fetterman and independent candidate Bob Hagan. While Hager highlights his government experience and conservative views, the other candidates aim to differentiate themselves in other ways.

TUCSON, Arizona (AP) - Arizona's performance on the court was shaky in the early going, particularly when it came to shooting from outside. However, when the Wildcats needed a big basket, they were able to deliver. According to coach Sean Miller, it was all about getting stops and making shots. The team's defense was a major factor in their comeback victory over Arizona State, as they held the Sun Devils to just 33% shooting and forced them to turn the ball over 17 times. Despite having a roster full of new players and old players in new roles, Arizona was able to pull off the 79-72 win.

Coach Bobby Hurley of Arizona State acknowledged that his team's defense was strong, but felt that their offense let them down. "We've just got to be able to play better defense," he said. "We've got to be able to run better offense."
Arizona's defense was the key to their victory, as they were able to limit Arizona State's scoring opportunities and create turnovers. The Wildcats' offense, on the other hand, was able to capitalize on their chances and make the most of their shots. With a 10-3 record and 1-1 in the Pac-12, Arizona is looking strong early in the season.

The rash on the womans neck is the size of a tennis ball .Its not

However, this is no laughing matter, as they delve into a medical journal article to explore a case of a girl admitted to the hospital with a rash and fever. Mark Ryan said further police resources were immediately deployed to the area over the weekend after the Murgon police prosecutor
continuation: said there was no evidence to indicate the home invasions were targeted . " I don ' t think they were targeted , " Mr Ryan stated ." I believe it was a random assault . input: CANBERRA, Australia -- A four-year search of the depths of the Indian Ocean has failed to find Malaysia Airlines Flight 370. But the unprecedented sonar hunt for the missing airliner might be close to solving 19th century mysteries - the locations of
continuation: the wreckage of the world ' s longest - ran shipwreck . The hunt for the aircraft , which vanished on March 8 , 2014 , has been plagued by bad weather and delays , but Australian officials say they are convinced they are close to finding the wreckage ." We are optimistic that we will locate the aircraft , " Australian Transport Minister Darren Chester said . The quest for the Boeing 777 - 200ER was launched in January 2014 after the aircraft ' s last known site was traced to a isolated part of the Indian Ocean .Chester said the sonar search , which has covered an area of 1 , 000 square kilometers ( 380 square miles ) , had unsuccessful to find the aircraft . " We have not found the aircraft , " he said ." But we are optimistic that we will locate the aircraft . " Chester said the hunt had been hampered by bad weather , but he was confident that the weather might improve in the come days ." We will continue to search for the aircraft until we have discovered the aircraft , " he said . Chester said the hunt would be prolonged if the hunt discovered the aircraft ." If we find the aircraft , we will extend the hunt , " he said .
paraphrase: In Canberra, Australia, a four-year underwater search for Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 has come up empty-handed. However, the innovative sonar hunt may soon uncover long-lost shipwrecks from the 19th century. Despite facing delays and bad weather, Australian officials remain optimistic about locating the missing aircraft, which vanished on March 8, 2014. Transport Minister Darren Chester expressed confidence, saying, "We are optimistic that we will locate the aircraft." The extensive search, launched in January 2014, has covered an area of 1,000 square kilometers (380 square miles) without success. Chester revealed that the sonar search has yet to find the aircraft, but he remains hopeful that better weather may improve the chances of discovery in the coming days. The search will continue until the aircraft is found, according to Chester. If the hunt does locate the aircraft, the search may be extended.

paraphrase:
When a resident of South Carolina discovered that the only employee at a Waffle House was fast asleep, they decided to prepare their own meal.

paraphrase:

This shift has led to a fundamental transformation in the structure and operation of companies. The growth of this market can be attributed to several factors, including the expansion of the middle class and the increasing demand for products and services. As a result, Indian businesses have been focusing on the B2B industry to meet the growing demand. The B2B industry involves the sale of goods and services by firms to other businesses. The team's success in the finals is what truly matters, not the number of wins or losses throughout the season.
In summary, Patrick Kane and Corey Crawford have been crucial to the Blackhawks' championship success, and their victory in the Stanley Cup this year is a testament to their skill and dedication.

input:
The glaring contradiction in Greeces government is producing a political crisis.
Left wing party Syriza was elected on an anti-austerity programme and now it is implementing the worst austerity measures yet.
To win a majority in parliament it is
continuation: now calling for a referendum on its own programme . But the referendum is a non - starter .It would taking a miracle for Syriza to reach a referendum on its own programme . The Greek people have already rejected the austerity measures .The only way Syriza can reach a referendum on its own programme now is to form a coalition cabinet with the right wing New Democracy group . But New Democracy is refusing to join Syriza .So Syriza has no choice but to call for a referendum on its own programme . This is a clear breach of the Greek constitution .The constitution tells that referendums must be held by the government . The constitution also said that referendums must be taken by a simple majority of the people .But Syriza is holding a referendum on its own programme . So what is the point of holding a referendum on its own programme ?Is it really a referendum on its programme ? Is it a referendum on the people ?Or is it a referendum on the government ? This is the question that the Greek people are ask themselves .If Syriza is going to hold a referendum on its own programme then it should also hold a referendum on the government  s
paraphrase: The intricate dilemma in Greece's political landscape is causing a crisis of leadership. The incoming left-wing administration, Syriza, campaigned on a platform of rejecting austerity measures, yet they are now implementing harsher measures than any other government in recent history. To regain control of the parliament, Syriza is calling for a referendum on their own policy, but this move is met with resistance from the opposition New Democracy party, who refuse to form a coalition government with Syriza. The referendum, held by Syriza without the backing of the government, raises questions about its legitimacy and purpose. Is it a true reflection of the people's will or simply a self-serving exercise in power? The Greek people are left wondering whether the referendum is a genuine attempt to gauge public sentiment or a ploy to maintain Syriza's grip on power.

Before there was television, there was radio.
TV took radios shows, sponsors and many of its stars. It took the concept of networks, the 30-minute time slot and theme songs.
It duplicated most of radio
continuation: s success . But it didnt duplicate all of it .The first television station , WJAS in Jacksonville , Fla . , went on the air in 1948 . It was known WJAS - TV , and it was the first television station in the United States .It was also the first to use the word television in its name . And it was the first to use the word transmission . WJAS - TV was owned and operated by the Jacksonville Broadcasting Company , and the stations first broadcast was on Sept . 23 , 1948 .The stations name was changed to WJAS - TV in 1950 . WJAS - TV was the first television station in the United States to have a news department .It was the first television station in the United States to have a childrens department . It was the first television station in the United States to have a sports department .It was the first television station in the United States to have a weather office . It was the first television station in the United States to have a traffic department .It was the first television station in the United States
paraphrase: Before the advent of television, radio reigned supreme. TV later adopted many of radio's successful elements, such as sponsors, stars, and the 30-minute time slot, but it also introduced new concepts, like networks and theme songs. The first television station, WJAS in Jacksonville, Florida, went on the air in 1948, and it was known as the first to use the words "television" and "transmission" in its name. WJAS-TV was owned and operated by the Jacksonville Broadcasting Company and began broadcasting on September 23, 1948. It was the first television station in the US to have a news, children's, sports, weather, and traffic department.

They were once seen as the preserve of the geek, but nowadays personal opinion and diary pages - weblogs or "blogs" - are so powerful that huge corporations are taking an interest.
The sites that started as observational home pages for enthusiasts have become
continuation: the main source of documentation for the general public . They are also the place where people share their personal stories , and where they publish their writing .As a result , they have become a way for people to express themselves and their views . I ' ve been thinking about this lately , because I ' ve noticed that some of the sites that have become my favorite have become more and more commercialized .I believe that this is a good thing , because it means that more persons are using the sites . But I also thought that it ' s a bad thing , because it means that some person are using the sites to make income .There are lots of blogs out there that are just for fun . Some of them are just for fun .But some of them are not . Some of them are trying to make cash , and some of them are trying to make cash by buying advertisements .Some of them are trying to make income by collecting data about their users . Some of them are trying to make cash by buying subscriptions .Some of them are trying to make cash by buying ads space . Some of them are trying to make cash by collecting personal data about their users .Some of them are trying to make money
paraphrase: In the past, personal opinion and diary pages, or "blogs," were considered the domain of tech-savvy individuals. However, their influence has grown significantly, to the point where large corporations are taking notice. Once just informal homepages for enthusiasts, these platforms have become the primary source of information for the general public. They have also become a space for people to share their personal experiences, publish their writing, and express their views. I have been pondering this topic lately, as I have noticed that some of my favorite blogs have become more commercialized. While some may view this as a negative development, I believe it is a good thing as it means more people are using these platforms. However, I also see it as a double-edged sword, as some individuals are using them to generate income through advertisements, subscriptions, and data collection. There are those that are purely for fun, while others aim to make money by any means necessary. It is interesting to observe the various tactics being employed, from buying ad space to collecting personal data about their users.

input: HOUSTON (CN)  A Mexican woman being held in a Houston immigration jail despite agreeing to return to the country she left with her parents as an infant won a small victory Monday when a federal judge said she should get a bond hearing to lobby for
continuation: her release . The woman , who is in her mid - 20s , is being held at the Harris County Jail in Houston on accusations of illegally reentering the U . S . after being deported in 2012 .She was ordered to be deported in 2013 after being convicted of illegal reentry , and was allowed to remain in the U . S . on a bond of $ 5 , 000 . She was convicted again in 2015 for illegally reentering the U . S . , and a court ordered her to be deported in 2016 .The woman , whose name is withheld because she is an immigrant , filed a motion in federal court yesterday month asking for a bond hearing . U . S . District Judge Sam Sparks denied her request Monday .She argued in her motion that she should have a bond hearing because she has no crime history and that she is not a flight risk .  The plaintiff has no crime history , does not pose a danger to public safety , and has no ties to any crime agencies ,  Sparks noted in his order .Sparks additionally highlighted that the woman  s father is a U . S . citizen and her parents is a Mexican citizen
paraphrase: A Houston immigrant, who was detained in an immigration jail despite agreeing to return to her country of origin as an infant, achieved a small victory when a federal judge ruled that she should receive a bond hearing to argue for her release. The woman, now in her mid-20s, is being held at the Harris County Jail in Houston on allegations of illegally reentering the US after being deported in 2012. She was ordered to be deported in 2013 following a conviction for illegal reentry and was allowed to remain in the US on a $5,000 bond. She was later convicted again in 2015 for illegally reentering the US and was ordered to be deported in 2016. The woman, who wishes to remain anonymous due to her immigration status, filed a motion in federal court last month asking for a bond hearing. However, US District Judge Sam Sparks denied her request on Monday. The judge noted that the woman has no criminal history, does not pose a danger to public safety, and has no ties to any criminal organizations. Additionally, Sparks highlighted that the woman's father is a US citizen and her parents are Mexican citizens.

PayPal will continue to manage payments for eBay ' s classified ads and marketplace services , but it will no longer be able to process payments for eBay ' s other services , like eBay ' s marketplace , StubHub , and PayPal ' s Cash App .Image source: Getty Images.Why did PayPal do this?It ' s not just that PayPal is terminating its relationship with eBay . While PayPal is stopping its partnership with eBay ' s competitors , it ' s still
paraphrase:
eBay is ending its payment processing partnership with PayPal, but let's dive deeper into the details.
eBay (NASDAQ: EBAY) recently unveiled a noteworthy surprise in its fourth-quarter earnings report, which may have a significant impact on PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL). eBay confirmed that it will be ending its transaction processing relationship with PayPal, which means that the e-commerce giant will no longer be able to process payments through PayPal's platform. PayPal will still manage payments for eBay's classified ads and marketplace services, but it will no longer be able to process payments for eBay's other services, such as its marketplace, StubHub, and PayPal's Cash App.
PayPal's decision to end its partnership with eBay's competitors is part of its strategy to focus on its core operations. By doing so, PayPal can concentrate on processing payments for eBay's core industries. While this move may come as a surprise, it's not entirely unexpected, given PayPal's long-standing efforts to focus on its core operations.
In summary, eBay's decision to end its payment processing partnership with PayPal may have significant implications for both companies, as they continue to operate in a highly competitive market.

WASHINGTON (CNNMoney)  The White House initial proposal to avert the fiscal cliff includes $200 billion in economic boosters  a stimulus plan Republican critics are railing against when they say the country needs to start reducing debt.
But even deficit hawks say
continuation: the plan is not enough to stave off the budget cliff .  It  s not enough ,  says Sen . Jim DeMint , R - S . C .  It  s not enough to getting the economy back on track .It  s not enough to bring people back to work . It  s not enough to keep the government open .  The White House plan is an attempt to revive the fiscal cliff deal that collapsed in the Senate earlier week .It includes a $ 200 billion tax cutting for households and businesses , as well as an increase in the baby tax credit . It additionally asks for $ 50 billion in spending cutting , including $ 30 billion in discretionary spending cutting and $ 10 billion in mandatory expenditure changes .The White House is also calling for $ 100 billion in spending cutting to Medicare and Medicaid . But the plan is not enough to stave off the fiscal cliff . I don  t think it  s enough to stave off the cliff ,  stated Sen . Lindsey Graham , R - S . C .  I don  t think it  s enough to getting the economy back on track .  De
paraphrase: The White House has proposed a plan to mitigate the fiscal cliff, which includes $200 billion in stimulus measures to boost the economy. However, Republican critics argue that the plan does not do enough to address the country's debt problem. According to Senator Jim DeMint, the plan is not enough to get the economy back on track, bring people back to work, or keep the government open. The proposal is an attempt to revive the previous fiscal cliff deal that failed in the Senate earlier in the week. It includes a $200 billion tax cut for households and businesses, as well as an increase in the child tax credit. Additionally, the plan calls for $50 billion in spending cuts, including $30 billion in discretionary spending cuts and $10 billion in mandatory spending changes. The White House is also pushing for $100 billion in spending cuts to Medicare and Medicaid. However, some lawmakers, such as Senator Lindsey Graham, do not believe the plan is enough to stave off the fiscal cliff and get the economy back on track.

I  m not asking for money , I  m asking for a heart ,  Cecil Chao says in a statement . I  m asking for a heart of love .  Chow Tsz - lok and Lee Siu - ming were husband and wife . Chow Tsz - lok  s mother , Cecil  s aunt , has also doubled the reward to $ 200 million . I  m begging you . paraphrase: A wealthy Hong Kong businessman has increased a reward from $65 million to $150 million for anyone who can win over his lesbian daughter's heart. In 2012, Cecil Chao initially offered the reward after learning that his daughter, Chow Tsz-lok, had fallen in love with another woman. However, Chow's boyfriend, Lee Siu-ming, was later sentenced to life in prison for the death of Chow's husband, also named Lee Siu-ming. Now, Chao has doubled the reward in the hopes of finding someone who can provide his daughter with the love and affection she desires. Chow's mother, Cecil's aunt, has also matched the reward amount to $200 million. Chao pleads with anyone who can help to please come forward, saying, "I'm not asking for money, I'm asking for a heart. I'm asking for a heart of love."

If you don ' t have a large display area , make sure that it ' s easy for your sales associates to find you .2 . paraphrase:
Here are some strategies to help your sales associates optimize their performance:
1. Designate a prominent location for your sales associates, making it easy for customers to find them. This is particularly important if you have a large display area.
2. Provide a clear pathway to the sales floor, allowing your sales associates to quickly and easily assist customers. Their role is to help shoppers find what they're looking for, after all!
3. Offer a clear navigation system to the sales room, making it simple for customers to find what they need.
4. Encourage your sales associates to engage with customers, asking questions and offering personalized recommendations to help them find what they're looking for. Their role is to assist shoppers, after all!
5. Provide your sales associates with a clear understanding of the products and services you offer, so they can answer questions and make informed recommendations. By empowering them with this knowledge, they'll be better equipped to help customers find what they need.

Friday, the Fourth National Climate Assessment was released. Its a sobering look at the economic and physical effects of climate change in the United States, and where those changes are leading.
At 1,656 pages, the report is massive
continuation: . The good news is that the study is consistent with what researchers have been saying for decades .The bad news is that it  s a sobering look at the economic and physical effects of climate warming in the United States , and where those changes are leading . The survey  s conclusion is that climate change is already costing the U . S . economy $ 1 . 5 trillion a year .That  s a lot of money , but it  s not that much cash when you  re talking about trillions of dollars a year in the economy .  The United States is the only country in the world that is suffering a net loss in gross domestic product ( GDP ) due to climate warming ,  the document says . Climate change is already costing the U . S . economy $ 1 . 5 trillion a year .  That  s a lot of money , but it  s not that much money when you  re talking about trillions of dollars a year in the economy . The statement , which was commissioned by the U . S . Environmental Protection Agency and the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration , is dubbed the Fourth National Climate Assessment .Its the
paraphrase: On Friday, the latest National Climate Assessment (NCA) was released, providing a comprehensive analysis of the economic and environmental impacts of climate change in the United States. The report, which spans 1,656 pages, highlights the consistent findings of researchers over the past decades: climate change is having a significant and costly effect on the U.S. economy. The NCA reveals that the country is experiencing a net loss in gross domestic product (GDP) due to climate change, with the economic toll amounting to $1.5 trillion annually. This is a substantial amount, but when considered against the trillions of dollars in the economy, it's a manageable sacrifice for the long-term benefits of mitigating climate change. The NCA, commissioned by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) and the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), is dubbed the Fourth National Climate Assessment. This assessment serves as a sobering reminder of the urgent need for climate action.

paraphrase: Sharing fertility struggles can be a sensitive and challenging issue for couples, and discussing it with friends and family may exacerbate the problem. A recent study published in the Journal of Sexual Medicine found that there are differences in how men and women handle this issue. The survey revealed that men who are infertile are more likely to openly discuss their fertility problems with their friends and family compared to women who are infertile. Gagnon and her team analyzed data from a survey of over 800 couples in the US participating in the National Health Interview Survey. The study found that the most common reason couples seek help from their friends and family is to talk about their fertility problems. Interestingly, the study also discovered that women who are infertile are more likely to seek help from their relatives and family if they are struggling with infertility.

input: Getting people to interact with others and upload content to a community-driven site enough may sound easy, but engagement doesnt happen automatically. It takes time and work, and much of the right formula is deduced through trial and error.
continuation: The next part of the puzzle is get people to interact with others and upload material to a community - driven site enough may sound easy , but participation doesn  t occur automatically . It requires time and work , and much of the right formula is deduced through trial and error .When it comes to social media , it  s important to be aware of what  s going on around you . If you  re not certain what  s going on , you  re not going to be able to engage with others and upload material to a community - driven site enough .Here  s how to getting people to interact with others and upload material to a community - driven site enough : 1 . Create a community When you  re creating a community , it  s important to create a place where citizens can communicate with each other and upload material to a community - driven site enough may sound easy , but participation doesn  t occur automatically .It took time and work , and much of the right formula is deduced through trial and error . When it comes to social media , it  s important to be aware of what  s going on around you
paraphrase:
Fostering interaction and content creation on a community-driven platform requires effort and experimentation. It's not as simple as it seems, as engagement and participation don't automatically follow. To create a thriving community, it's crucial to establish a space where users can interact with each other and share content effectively. Here are some strategies to help achieve this:
1. Build a community: When creating a community, it's essential to create a space where users can communicate with each other and share content seamlessly. This involves careful planning and execution to ensure that the community feels welcoming and inclusive.
2. Stay informed: In today's fast-paced social media landscape, it's crucial to stay up-to-date with the latest trends and developments. By doing so, you can better engage with your audience and create content that resonates with them.
3. Encourage interaction: Encourage users to interact with each other by creating opportunities for them to share their thoughts and ideas. This can be done through various means, such as hosting discussions, organizing events, or sharing user-generated content.
4. Provide incentives: To motivate users to create and share content, provide incentives such as recognition, rewards, or exclusive access to content. This can help to boost engagement and participation, ultimately leading to a more vibrant community.
5. Monitor and adjust: Continuously monitor the community's performance and make adjustments as needed. This involves staying on top of analytics, responding to feedback, and adapting to changing trends and preferences. By doing so, you can ensure that your community remains engaging and relevant.

By following these strategies, you can create a thriving community where users are motivated to interact and share content. However, remember that success doesn't come overnight, and it takes time, effort, and experimentation to find the right formula for your community.

China pledges "notable" emissions cut but some find lack of firm number disappointing.
But the leader of the world's biggest emitter dashed hopes that he would unveil a hard target to kickstart stalled climate talks due to be reconvened in
continuation: December . " China will make a notable reduction in its carbon emissions , " Xi said in a nationally televised speech ." China will take the necessary measures to achieve emissions neutrality by 2060 , " he added , without give a time frame . China has committed to peak carbon emissions by 2030 , but has yet to put a date for when it will achieve that goal .Xi ' s speech came as the United States and China were locked in a bitter trade war that has battered global markets . The United States and China are locked in a bitter trade war that has battered global markets .The United States and China are locked in a bitter trade war that has battered global markets . paraphrase:
China has vowed to make a substantial reduction in its carbon emissions, according to President Xi Jinping. He told his nation in a televised address that China will take the necessary measures to achieve carbon neutrality by 2060, although he did not provide a specific timeline. Although China has pledged to peak its carbon emissions by 2030, it has yet to set a date for when it will accomplish this goal. Xi's address came as the United States and China were embroiled in a contentious trade war that had shaken global markets.
Despite China's promise to reduce its carbon footprint, some experts were disappointed that President Xi did not provide a more specific timeline for achieving this goal. They noted that the lack of a firm deadline could make it challenging to measure China's progress and hold it accountable for its commitments. However, many analysts were heartened by China's willingness to address the issue of climate change, given the country's status as the world's largest emitter of greenhouse gases.
The trade war between the United States and China has had far-reaching consequences, including a decline in global trade and a deceleration of economic growth. This conflict has highlighted the importance of cooperation between the two nations on environmental issues, as well as the need for them to find a peaceful resolution to their trade differences.
In summary, while some experts were disappointed by the lack of a specific timeline for China's emissions reduction, the country's commitment to addressing climate change is a positive step forward. The ongoing trade war between the United States and China underscores the need for cooperation on environmental issues and the importance of finding a peaceful resolution to their differences.

A gunman killed 12 people, including a sheriffs
continuation: deputy , at the Borderline Bar & Grill in Thousand Oaks on Wednesday day . The shooter , identified as Ian David Long , opened fire at the bar around 11 : 30 p . m . local time , according to the Ventura County Sheriff  s Office .Long was described as a 21 - month - old white man from Newbury Park , California , according to reports . The sheriff  s office stated he had a  long history of psychological disease ,  according to the Ventura County Star .Long was seized at the scene and has been charged with murder , attempted murder , attack with a semiautomatic firearm , possession of a firearm by a felon , and possession of a firearm by a prohibited people , according to the Ventura County Sheriff  s Office . He is being held without bail at the Ventura County Jail , according to the Ventura County Sheriff  s Office website .A motivation for the shooting has not already been released . This is a developing tale .Please check back for updates . Copyright 2018 Raycom News Network .All rights reserved .

Tragedy Strikes Thousand Oaks Again: 12 Lives Lost in Latest Mass Shooting
Less than two weeks after the devastating synagogue shooting in Pittsburgh that claimed 11 lives, another massacre has struck Thousand Oaks, California. On Wednesday night, a gunman opened fire at the Borderline Bar & Grill, leaving 12 people dead, including a sheriff's deputy. The suspect, identified as Ian David Long, a 21-month-old white man from Newbury Park, California, was taken into custody at the scene and has been charged with multiple counts of murder, attempted murder, and other offenses. According to the Ventura County Sheriff's Office, Long had a history of mental health issues. This latest shooting has left the community in shock and grief, with a motive for the attack still unknown. input: Andrew P. Fitzgerald, 50, formerly of Plattsburgh, N.Y., passed away Tuesday, March 5, 2019, at Sarasota Memorial Hospital with his family by his side. He was born in Plattsburgh, N.Y.,
continuation: on May 21 , 1968 , brother of the late Robert Fitzgerald and Mary ( McNally ) Fitzgerald . Andrew was a alumnus of Plattsburgh High School , Class of 1987 .He was employed as a machinist at the Plattsburgh Navy Yard . Andrew loved fishing , hunting , and spending time with his family .He was a member of the Plattsburgh Moose Lodge . Andrew is survived by his loving wife of 20 decades , Linda ( Hansen ) Fitzgerald of Plattsburgh , N . Y . ; a son , Christopher Fitzgerald of Plattsburgh , N . Y . ; a son , Ashley Fitzgerald of Plattsburgh , N . Y . ; a brother , Robert Fitzgerald of Plattsburgh , N . Y . ; a brother , Susan Fitzgerald of Plattsburgh , N . paraphrase: Andrew Fitzgerald, a devoted husband, father, and member of the Plattsburgh community, passed away on Tuesday, March 5, 2019, surrounded by his loved ones at Sarasota Memorial Hospital. He was born on May 21, 1968, in Plattsburgh, New York, to parents Mary (McNally) and the late Robert Fitzgerald. Andrew was a proud alumnus of Plattsburgh High School, Class of 1987, and worked as a skilled machinist at the Plattsburgh Navy Yard. His passions included fishing, hunting, and spending time with his family. Andrew was an active member of the Plattsburgh Moose Lodge and cherished the time he spent with his loving wife of 20 years, Linda (Hansen) Fitzgerald, and their two sons, Christopher and Ashley. He is also survived by his brother, Robert Fitzgerald, and sisters, Susan Fitzgerald and Mary Fitzgerald, as well as several nieces and nephews. Andrew was preceded in death by his brother, Robert Fitzgerald Jr., and cousin-in-law, Linda Fitzgerald. A Mass of Christian Burial will be held at 10 a.m. on Friday, March 8, 2019, at St. John the Baptist Catholic Church in Plattsburgh, New York.

input: Alastair Cook has been granted more time to decide his future as Test captain, with England having privately advised that Fridays meeting with the director of cricket, Andrew Strauss, will not be followed by a definitive announcement on the subject.

Cook has been in regular contact with Strauss over the past few weeks and has been given until Friday afternoon to make a final decision on his future. The England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) and the England and Wales Cricket Board Players Association (ECBPA) have approached Cook for a resolution on his position, which has been under scrutiny in recent weeks. The ECB had previously stated that Cook would not be retained as captain for the Ashes series in Australia, but he has continued to communicate with Strauss, who took over as manager of cricket in July. The team's union has been in touch with the ECB over the past few weeks, and it is understood that the players are supportive of Cook's decision. The Utah Compact is a document outlining the objectives and values of the corporate community .It was originally adopted in 2010 , but it has been altered twice since then .  I  m very proud of the Utah Compact ,  says Derek Miller , president and CEO of the Salt Lake Chamber . It  s a better document . It  s one of the best documents in the nation .  The Utah Compact is not a binding document , but it has been used as a guide by cities and county councils . It  s a tool to assist guide our public policy ,  Miller explained . Patients who need cannabis as treatment have been forgotten, and before discussing the recreational use of the plant, Malta should prioritise access to more medicinal cannabis preparations, the authorities are being urged.
It is upsetting to be
continuation: reminded that the patients who need cannabis as therapy have been forgotten ,  says the Malta Medical Association in a statement .  The government should prioritise access to more medicinal cannabis preparations .  Malta  s Medical Cannabis Association stated the cabinet  s  lack of action  on the issue was  unacceptable  . It is not acceptable that a patient who needs a medicinal cannabis product should have to travel elsewhere to access it ,  the organization said .  The government should take swift action to ensure that patients can obtain medicinal cannabis in Malta .  Cannabidiol , or CBD , is a chemical in cannabis that has been shown to have a number of health benefits .The Malta Medical Association stated the authorities  s failure of action on the issue was  unacceptable  .  It is not acceptable that a patient who needs a medicinal cannabis product should have to travel elsewhere to access it ,  the organization said . The government should take swift action to ensure that patients can obtain medicinal cannabis in Malta .

They stress that before discussing the recreational use of the plant, the government should prioritize increasing access to more medicinal cannabis preparations. The Association finds it unacceptable that patients must travel elsewhere to obtain the medication they need, emphasizing that Malta should take swift action to ensure patients can access medicinal cannabis within the country. paraphrase:
Finding the ideal headphones can be a daunting task. As an audio engineer who has worked on over 400 Tiny Desk Concerts at NPR, Josh Rogosin is well-versed in the art of sound quality and is here to provide some guidance. In this Tiny Tech Tips article, we will explore the key factors to consider when searching for the perfect headphones.
First and foremost, it is important to determine the primary use of the headphones. Are they for casual listening, or will they be used for critical listening, such as mixing and mastering? This will help you narrow down your options and find headphones that are tailored to your specific needs.
Next, consider the sound signature of the headphones. Do you prefer a bright, detailed sound or a warmer, more mellow sound? This will help you find headphones that will provide the best possible listening experience for your ears.
Another important factor to consider is the comfort level of the headphones. Will you be wearing them for extended periods of time? Do they fit snugly on your head, or do they feel uncomfortable? Make sure to choose headphones that are both comfortable and provide good sound quality.
In addition to these factors, it is also important to consider the build quality of the headphones. Are they durable and well-constructed, or do they feel flimsy and cheap? A well-made pair of headphones will provide better sound quality and last longer.
Finally, consider the price of the headphones. While it is true that you often get what you pay for, it is also important to find headphones that fit within your budget. Look for headphones that offer good value for the price, without sacrificing sound quality.
In conclusion, finding the perfect headphones is a complex process that requires careful consideration of several factors. By taking the time to research and compare different options, you can find headphones that provide the best possible listening experience for your ears.

paraphrase:
What are the most and least valuable college degrees for Floridians?
The common career advice given to young people seems straightforward, but it's not always easy to put into practice. While some people know exactly what they want to do and are set on pursuing their passions, others face more complex challenges. A recent study from the National Center for Education Statistics reveals that the value of a college degree may not be as high as the cost, leading to confusion about the value of different degrees.
The study examined the value of master's degrees, bachelor's degrees, and career certificates, finding that the value of a bachelor's degree decreased by $10,000 on average for every year of study. The value of a master's degree dropped by $15,000 on average for every year of study, while the price of a career certificate decreased by $20,000 on average for every year of study.
Overall, the study suggests that while a college degree may not be worth as much as it once was, it can still provide significant benefits in terms of career opportunities and earning potential. It's important for Floridians to carefully consider their options and choose a degree that aligns with their passions and career goals.

In a vote of 100 - 0 , the Co - op Grocery Workers  Union ( CGWU ) approved a resolution calling for a boycott of Israeli products .The resolution was introduced in April by CGWU leader , David Zwirner , and co - sponsored by the CGWU  s affiliate associations in New York , New Jersey , and Connecticut . paraphrase: Despite the ongoing siege of Gaza and the escalating displacement in the Negev and East Jerusalem, Palestinians have some cause for celebration. In Washington, a food co-op has passed a resolution calling for a boycott of Israeli products, confirming that the movement is gaining momentum. In a unanimous vote of 100-0, the Co-op Grocery Workers Union (CGWU) approved a resolution calling for a boycott of Israeli products. The resolution was introduced in April by CGWU leader David Zwirner and co-sponsored by the CGWU's affiliate associations in New York, New Jersey, and Connecticut. Zwirner told Mondoweiss that the resolution is a first step towards the eventual end of the Israeli occupation of Palestine. "This is not a call for boycotts against Israel," Zwirner emphasized. "This is a call for a boycott of Israeli products." Zwirner explained that the CGWU is a labor federation representing grocery workers in New York, New Jersey, and Connecticut, and that they represent over 50,000 grocery jobs in those three states.

paraphrase:
The seasoned industry professional will be recognized for their groundbreaking achievements with a 2013 Clio Lifetime Achievement Award in May. In this interview with Co.Create, they share their insights on fighting for one's ideas, navigating challenging client relationships, and prioritizing one's own well-being.
Co.Create: How did you start your career in the industry?
Jeffrey Kagan: I've been working in advertising for 30 years, and I've been a part of the creative industry for about 20 of those years. I've had the privilege of working in various departments, but my true passion has always been creativity.
Co.Create: What's your favorite aspect of your job?
Jeffrey Kagan: I'm a storyteller at heart. I enjoy crafting tales that evoke emotions and inspire others. I love making people feel less alone and encouraging them to think critically.
Co.Create: You've had the opportunity to work with some of the biggest agencies in the country. How do you stay up-to-date on the latest industry trends?
Jeffrey Kagan: I've been fortunate to work with a diverse group of people, including talented individuals and remarkable organizations. I've had the chance to collaborate with exceptional clients, which has allowed me to stay current on industry trends.
Co.Create: What advice do you have for aspiring creatives looking to make a name for themselves in the industry?
Jeffrey Kagan: My advice to young creatives is to never give up on their ideas. Fight for what you believe in, even when faced with adversity. Always prioritize your health and well-being, as it's essential for producing your best work. And never be afraid to take risks and push the boundaries of what's possible.

input:
A comeback story was crowned with a happy ending at Wimbledon on Saturday  but it was the revitalised Angelique Kerber rather than Serena Williams who lifted the trophy.
With the Duchesses of Sussex and Cambridge in the Royal Box and Tiger
continuation: Woods in the Royal Box , the atmosphere was electric . But it was Kerber , the world No 2 , who had the audience on its foot as she beat Williams 6 - 3 6 - 4 in the final to claim her first Grand Slam final .The German was in crying after the match , as she held her head in her hands , and said : " I didn ' t expect to win . I ' m so happy ." It ' s been a long time since I played a Grand Slam final . It ' s a fantasy come true . "Kerber , 27 , had lost her final three Grand Slam finals , notably the 2016 Australian Open , and was booed on her way to the court . But she was decided not to let that stop her , and won the first set 6 - 3 .But Williams , the 23 - time Grand Slam champion , won the second set 6 - 4 . Kerber , who had rarely won a Grand Slam final before , was on the verge of tears after the third set ." I was so nervous , I was just thought , ' I ' m going to lose this match , I ' m going to lose this match ' , " she said . " I ' m just so happy , so
paraphrase:
A stunning turn of events unfolded at Wimbledon on Saturday, as an unlikely hero emerged victorious. Despite the presence of royalty in the crowd, including the Duchesses of Sussex and Cambridge and golf legend Tiger Woods, it was Germany's Angelique Kerber who captured the championship.
With tears streaming down her face, Kerber declared, "I didn't think I was going to win. I'm so happy!" After losing her last three Grand Slam finals, including the 2016 Australian Open, Kerber was determined to make this one her own. She dominated the first set 6-3 and fought off a second-set scare from Williams to take it 6-4.
The 27-year-old Kerber was on the verge of tears after the third set, but her nerves of steel prevailed as she emerged victorious in the end. "I was so nervous, I was just thinking, 'I'm going to lose this match, I'm going to lose this match,'" she admitted. "But I'm just so happy, so grateful to have this opportunity."
Williams, the 23-time Grand Slam champion, put up a valiant fight, but Kerber's resilience and determination ultimately proved to be too much for her. Despite the loss, Williams' legacy as one of the greatest tennis players of all time remains untarnished.

input:
Queen Elizabeth II delivered a Christmas Day speech to Britons about the importance of coming together and making sacrifices  but she apparently didnt put much thought into the decor.
The monarch was blasted for making the speech calling for self-sacrifice while
continuation: she and Prince Philip were on a royal tour of Kenya and Tanzania . The Queen , who has spent a lot of time in the United Kingdom over the years , told about the importance of coming together and sacrificing . This Christmas , as we celebrate the birth of our Savior , let us reflect on the fact that the greatest gift we can offer one another is self - sacrifice ,  she said .  It is a gift we can offer to our families , to our communities , to our nation , and to our world .  The Queen did not place much thought into the decor for her speech .Her Majesty  s speech was greeted with criticism on social media for its lack of decor , with many people pointing out that the Queen  s speech was given in Kenya and Tanzania , two countries that don  t have a lot of Christmas ornaments .  I don  t know what she was thinking ,  one Twitter user stated . The Queen of England delivering a Christmas address in Kenya and Tanzania with no Christmas decorations .  I don  t know what she was thinking . The Queen of England delivering a Christmas address in Kenya and Tanzania with no Christmas decorations
paraphrase:
Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II recently delivered a heartfelt speech to the British people during the Christmas celebrations, emphasizing the importance of coming together and making sacrifices for the greater good. However, some have criticized the monarch for not putting much thought into the aesthetics of the speech, given that she and Prince Philip were on a royal tour of Kenya and Tanzania at the time. Despite this, the Queen's message of selflessness and unity remained clear, urging the nation to reflect on the true meaning of Christmas and the gift of sacrifice that can bring people together. Texas has become the first state in the nation to require law enforcement to obtain a warrant to read people's email, and privacy advocates are hoping the move will help quicken the passage of a similar proposal in Congress.
Texas Gov. Rick Perry signed
continuation: the bill into law on Monday , making it the first state in the nation to require law enforcement to obtain a warrant to read people ' s email . The legislation , which takes effect in July , also provides law enforcement to keep a record of all emails they receive and delete them if they are no longer relevant to an investigation .The legislation also provides law enforcement officers to notify people of their right to be quiet and to obtain a warrant if it ' s essential to read their emails . " This is a step in the right direction , " added John W . Whitehead , executive director of the American Civil Liberties Union of Texas , which supported the bill ." It is a very important step . " The bill was sponsored by state Sen . Lois Kolkhorst , R - Houston , and passed the Texas Senate in May .It passed the Texas House of Representatives in May by a vote of 105 - 5 . The bill ' s sponsor , state Sen . Lois Kolkhorst , R - Houston , said in a statement that the bill " will assist guarantee that law enforcement is not reading people ' s emails in the privacy of their homes . "" It will also help ensure that law enforcement is not reading people ' s emails in the privacy of their homes , "
paraphrase:
Texas has made history by becoming the first state to mandate that law enforcement agencies obtain a warrant before accessing private email accounts. This move has sparked hope among privacy advocates that a similar federal law may be passed soon. Governor Rick Perry signed the bill into law on Monday, which will go into effect in July. The legislation also requires law enforcement agencies to keep a record of all emails received and delete them if they are no longer relevant to an investigation. Additionally, law enforcement officials will be required to inform individuals of their right to remain silent and their option to obtain a warrant if necessary.
"This is a significant step forward," said John W. Whitehead, executive director of the American Civil Liberties Union of Texas, which supported the bill. "It is a crucial step towards protecting the privacy of individuals in their digital communications." The bill was sponsored by state Senator Lois Kolkhorst, R-Houston, and passed the Texas Senate in May before being approved in the Texas House of Representatives by a vote of 105-5.
Kolkhorst emphasized that the bill will help ensure that law enforcement agencies cannot access private email accounts without proper authorization. "It will also help ensure that law enforcement agencies cannot access private email accounts without proper authorization," she said in a statement.

The 12-passenger Electronic Autonomous shuttle, or E
continuation: AS , was announced at the Calgary Zoo Thursday . " We are very excited to be the first city in North America to have a driverless shuttle , " explained Coun .Druh Farrell . " We want to make sure that this is a tech that is accessible to everyone .We want to make sure that this is something that is affordable for everyone . paraphrase:
In a groundbreaking move, the city is set to introduce driverless buses and other vehicles, following the success of an autonomous shuttle soon to run between the Calgary Zoo and Telus Spark. The 12-passenger Electronic Autonomous Shuttle (EAS) was unveiled at the Calgary Zoo on Thursday. The shuttle will travel between the zoo's east side and Telus Spark, and will be operated by a driverless vehicle system. However, a pilot will remain in the vehicle at all times for safety purposes.
Councillor Druh Farrell expressed excitement about the city's innovative initiative, stating, "We are thrilled to be the first city in North America to introduce a driverless shuttle. Our goal is to make this technology accessible and affordable for everyone." Farrell highlighted the pilot project's significance, emphasizing that it marks the beginning of a new chapter for the city. "This is not just a pilot project; it's the start of a journey for us," she said. "We're committed to embracing innovation and making the most of our resources."
The EAS is a state-of-the-art self-driving vehicle capable of reaching speeds of up to 30 kilometers per hour. It's equipped with advanced cameras and sensors, enabling it to navigate safely and efficiently. This pioneering project represents the city's dedication to efficiency and the responsible use of resources.

( AP Photo / Khalil Senosi ) But Mr Okindo said he will never forget what happened on that fateful day ." We went to the scene and we saw corpses on the ground . We seen everyone bleeding , " he said ." There were people who were still alive , but they were in a very bad condition . paraphrase: It has been a decade since Al-Qaeda first emerged, and the US is still engaged in conflicts with terrorist groups. In a well-manicured garden in Nairobi, Joash Okindo makes his way towards a marble plaque dedicated to those who lost their lives in the Al-Qaeda-linked terrorist attack on the Westgate Mall in Kenya in 2013. "This is the first time I have come here," he says, reflecting on the ten years since the initial attack. Mr. Okindo is a member of the Kenyan Red Cross Society, the country's leading humanitarian organization, which was established in 1884. "We have been here for over a century and have never experienced a major assault," he states with conviction. Despite this, the Kenyan Red Cross Society has been at the forefront of the country's response to the Westgate Mall attacks, which claimed the lives of 67 people in 2013. Mr. Okindo, however, is unwilling to forget the traumatic events of that day. "We went to the scene and saw bodies strewn across the ground. There were people bleeding everywhere, and we did our best to provide aid," he recalls. "We tried to get them to the hospital, but it was too late. They were beyond saving," he adds, his voice filled with emotion.

INPUT: Like a wave crashing against the shore, the moment passed quickly.
But in that fleeting instant - noon on Saturday - over 240 people gathered at the water's edge in Atlantic and Neptune Beach, holding each other's hands in shared grief. In that instant, I felt overwhelmed and unable to breathe as I had never been to a memorial service for someone I didn't know.
