The Best Buy logo on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange in New York on Nov. 12, 2018.
In naming Corie Barry chief executive officer, Best Buy Co. hands the reins to the architect of its current growth strategy, widely
continuation: credited with turning around the struggling electronics chain . Barry , 53 , who has been Best Buy ' s chief financial officer since 2010 , will become CEO on Jan . 1 , 2019 , the company said Tuesday .She will succeed Hubert Joly , who will become executive chairman of the board . Barry will become the first woman to lead the company , which has been run by men since its establishment in 1962 .The new CEO will also be the first woman to lead a Fortune 500 company . " I am honored to lead Best Buy as we continue to evolve our business and transform the customer experience , " Barry said in a statement ." We have an incredible opportunity to build on our momentum and build long - term value for our clients , workers and shareholders . " Barry , who has been with Best Buy since 2006 , was elected CFO in 2010 .She has held a number of management roles at the company , including vice president of human resources , head information executive and chief operating executive . Joly , who taken over as CEO in 2015 , has been credited with reviving the
paraphrase:
Best Buy's logo on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange in New York on November 12, 2018, marks a significant milestone in the company's history. The appointment of Corie Barry as chief executive officer, effective January 1, 2019, is a testament to her leadership and vision. Barry, who has been the company's chief financial officer since 2010, will become the first woman to lead Best Buy, which has been led by men since its establishment in 1962. This achievement also makes her the first woman to lead a Fortune 500 company.
In a statement, Barry expressed her gratitude and excitement for the opportunity to lead Best Buy. She emphasized the company's momentum and potential for growth, highlighting the need to build long-term value for customers, employees, and shareholders. Barry has been with Best Buy since 2006 and has held various management roles, including vice president of human resources, head of information technology, and chief operating executive.
Under Joly's leadership since 2015, Best Buy's stock price has shown impressive growth, increasing nearly 50% since then. Joly, who took over as CEO in 2015, has been credited with revitalizing the company through innovative strategies and a focus on customer experience. As Barry assumes her new role, she inherits a company with a strong foundation and a bright future ahead.

Traffic deaths in California fell 9 percent last year  the biggest drop in 14 years  and crashes on Highway 17 continued their nearly decadelong decline.
State officials attribute the decline in road-related deaths statewide to more Californians wearing their seat
continuation: belts , and to a sharp drop in the number of people driving drunk . But the number of people killed in crashes on the state  s freeways continues to climb , and the number of people killed on the state  s highways continues to rise .The amount of people killed in accidents on California  s freeways last year declined 9 percent from the previous year , the biggest drop in 14 decades , according to a report published Tuesday by the California Department of Transportation . The amount of people killed in accidents on the state  s freeways last month was just over 3 , 000 , a drop of 7 percent from the previous year , the report says .The amount of people killed in accidents on the state  s freeways in 2012 was just over 3 , 600 , an increase of 14 percent from the previous year . The amount of people killed in accidents on the state  s freeways in 2012 was the highest in more than a years .The amount of people killed in accidents on the state  s freeways in 2012 was the highest in more than a years .  We  re not out of the woods yet ,  Caltrans Director Brian Kelly told .
paraphrase: Traffic fatalities in California decreased by 9% last year, marking the largest drop in 14 years. However, crashes on Highway 17 continued their nearly decade-long decline. State officials attribute the overall decline in road-related deaths to increased seatbelt usage and a significant decrease in drunk driving-related fatalities. However, fatalities on state freeways have been on the rise, with a 7% increase in the number of people killed in accidents on these roads last month compared to the previous year. The number of fatalities on state highways also increased by 14% in 2012, the highest in over a year. While progress has been made, according to Caltrans Director Brian Kelly, "we are not out of the woods yet."

input: SAGINAW, MI  A Saginaw County businessman, Paul Mitchell, recently announced he plans to seek the Republican nomination to run for the State Senate seat being vacated in 2014 by Sen. Roger Kahn, R-Saginaw.
continuation: Mitchell , a Saginaw Township native , said he expects to announce his nomination for the seat at a media conference at 1 p . m . Thursday , June 12 , at the Saginaw County Republican Party headquarters , 1241 N . Broadway , Saginaw . Mitchell , who is head of the Saginaw County Chamber of Commerce , said he expects to run on a platform of fiscal responsibility and limited government . I am run for the Senate to restore fiscal responsibility and limited government ,  Mitchell stated in a statement .  I feel forward to working with the Republican majority to create jobs , cut taxes , and protect the freedom of our citizens .  Mitchell stated he has been a resident of Saginaw County for 30 years . I have been involved in the Saginaw County Republican Party for the previous 25 years ,  Mitchell stated .  I have a solid record of backing the Republican Party , and I am committed to serving the people of Saginaw County .  Mitchell stated he has served as a member of the Saginaw County Board of Commissioners , the Saginaw County Board of Education , the S
paraphrase:
A local businessman in Saginaw County, Paul Mitchell, has announced his intention to seek the Republican nomination for the upcoming State Senate seat. Mitchell, a native of Saginaw Township, plans to make his nomination official at a media conference on Thursday, June 12, at the Saginaw County Republican Party headquarters.
Mitchell, who is the head of the Saginaw County Chamber of Commerce, said he aims to run on a platform of fiscal responsibility and limited government. "I am running for the Senate to restore fiscal responsibility and limited government," Mitchell stated in a statement. "I look forward to working with the Republican majority to create jobs, cut taxes, and protect the freedom of our citizens."
Mitchell has been a resident of Saginaw County for 30 years and has been involved in the local Republican Party for the past 25 years. "I have a solid record of backing the Republican Party, and I am committed to serving the people of Saginaw County," he said.
In addition to his business experience, Mitchell has served as a member of the Saginaw County Board of Commissioners and the Saginaw County Board of Education. He has a proven track record of advocating for the needs of his community and is well-positioned to represent Saginaw County in the State Senate.

input:
Years after his death, an anonymous letter has led to a suspect in the fatal hit-and-run that killed Baylor University sophomore David Grotberg.
Gabrielle Lyons was asking for $750,000 from the university in a lawsuit she
continuation: filed in 2015 , alleged that it failed to take care of Grotberg , who was struck by a vehicle as he strolled across the street . Grotberg , 20 , was pronounced dead at Baylor Medical Center in Waco , Texas , after being hit by a vehicle on Feb . 4 , 2015 .Lyons  lawsuit claimed that Baylor failed to take care of Grotberg , who had been diagnosed with schizophrenia , bipolar disorder and an eat disorder . The university settled the litigation in 2017 , agreeing to pay $ 1 . 5 million , according to the Waco Tribune - Herald .Lyons , who was not named in the litigation , said in a court filing that Grotberg was struck by a vehicle that was travelling erratically , and that she didn  t know the driver of the car . Grotberg had been walking across the street with a colleague when he was struck , the litigation said .Lyons said in her filed that she learned that the driver of the car that struck Grotberg was a Baylor student who had recently moved to Waco . Lyons said she needed Baylor to pay for Grotberg  s burial , as well as his mental health treatment .
paraphrase:
Years after the tragic incident, a mysterious letter has led to a potential suspect in the fatal hit-and-run that claimed the life of Baylor University sophomore David Grotberg. In 2015, Gabrielle Lyons filed a lawsuit against the university, alleging that it failed to provide adequate care for Grotberg, who was struck by a vehicle as he crossed the street. Grotberg, just 20 years old at the time of his death, was pronounced dead at Baylor Medical Center in Waco, Texas, after the fatal accident occurred on February 4, 2015.
Lyons' lawsuit claimed that Baylor University neglected its duty to care for Grotberg, who had been diagnosed with schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, and an eating disorder. The university eventually settled the litigation in 2017, agreeing to pay $1.5 million, according to the Waco Tribune-Herald. Lyons, who was not named in the lawsuit, stated in a court filing that Grotberg was struck by a car that was traveling erratically, and that she did not know the driver. Grotberg had been walking across the street with a friend when he was hit, the lawsuit revealed.
Lyons maintained that she needed Baylor to cover the costs of Grotberg's burial, as well as his mental health treatment. The development has raised questions about the university's responsibility to its students and the community, and the need for better support services for those struggling with mental health issues.

input: In all probability, the main Hazratganj crossing is likely to be named after former prime minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee, as the executive committee of the Lucknow Municipal Corporation, in a meeting on Friday, gave power to mayor
continuation: Rakesh Kumar Singh to naming the crossing after Vajpayee .  Vajpayee was one of the most popular politicians of the nation .We want to commemorate him by naming the Hazratganj crossing after him ,  says mayor Rakesh Kumar Singh .  It is not possible to naming Hazratganj crossing after the entire Hazratganj neighborhood .Therefore , we have decided to naming it after Vajpayee ,  he added . The decision to naming the crossing after Vajpayee was taken at a conference of the executive commission of the Lucknow Municipal Corporation on Friday .Vajpayee , who was the prime secretary of India between 1996 and 2004 , died on August 16 . The Lucknow Municipal Corporation has already designated Hazratganj crossing after ex leader Pranab Mukherjee .
paraphrase: It is probable that the main crossing in Hazratganj will be named after the former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee, as the executive committee of the Lucknow Municipal Corporation has given the mayor, Rakesh Kumar Singh, the authority to make this decision. Vajpayee was a highly revered politician in the country, and the corporation wishes to honor him by naming the crossing after him, according to Singh. Naming the entire Hazratganj neighborhood after the crossing would not be feasible, therefore, the decision has been made to name it after Vajpayee instead. This decision was reached during a meeting of the executive committee of the Lucknow Municipal Corporation on Friday. Vajpayee, who served as Prime Minister of India from 1996 to 2004, passed away on August 16. The Lucknow Municipal Corporation has already designated a crossing in Hazratganj after a former leader, Pranab Mukherjee.

input:
What Is Business-Casual or Fancy-Casual Dress Attire?
Button-up shirts and khaki slacks work for men or women.
Dress codes at work can be confounding. Offices have loosened up and introduced business
continuation: - casual dress codes , but what exactly is business - casual or fancy - casual dress dress ? The answer , according to clothing experts , is that dress codes vary depending on the company and the culture of the workplace . It  s really important to remember what your firm  s clothes code is and what it is not ,  says Melissa Hagan , founder and CEO of the clothing company The Hagan Company .  Some firms have dress codes that are more formal than others .  Hagan says that at one of her earlier corporations , the dress code was  business casual ,  which meant that men and ladies were expected to wore button - up shirts and khaki slacks .But at another company , the dress code was  fancy casual ,  which meant that men and ladies were expected to wore button - up shirts and khaki slacks .  It  s really important to remember what your firm  s clothes code is and what it is not ,  says Melissa Hagan , founder and CEO of the clothing company The Hagan Company . Some firms have dress codes that are more formal than others .
paraphrase:
Understanding Business-Casual and Fancy-Casual Dress Codes
The concept of dress codes in the workplace can be perplexing, with varying interpretations and expectations. According to clothing experts, business-casual and fancy-casual dress codes are not one-size-fits-all categories. The dress code depends on the company culture and values, as well as the industry and work environment.
For men and women, button-up shirts and khaki slacks are considered appropriate attire in many workplaces, including traditional business settings. However, it's essential to be aware of the specific dress code policies in place at your workplace, as they may vary in terms of formality and style.
In some companies, the dress code may be more formal, while in others, it may be more relaxed. For example, at one workplace, the dress code may be strictly business professional, requiring men and women to wear button-up shirts and khaki slacks. In contrast, at another company, the dress code may be more fashion-forward, allowing for button-up shirts and khaki slacks as part of a fancy-casual dress code.
To navigate these different dress code expectations, it's crucial to stay informed and up-to-date on your company's dress code policies. Melissa Hagan, founder and CEO of The Hagan Company, emphasizes the importance of understanding what is expected of you in terms of dress code, as it can vary greatly between companies and industries.
In summary, while button-up shirts and khaki slacks may be a suitable dress code for many workplaces, it's vital to understand the specific guidelines and expectations of your workplace to ensure a professional and appropriate image.

Despite the setback, the talented pass rusher is expected to play against the New York Giants on Sunday, according to Chargers coach Anthony Lynn. Lynn expressed his delight at Bosa's return, highlighting his hard work and dedication to his rehabilitation. The coach also emphasized the significance of Bosa's return to the team's defense, citing his role as a key pass rusher and his ability to disrupt the quarterback's rhythm. Furthermore, Lynn noted that Bosa's return is a significant boost to the team's overall pass rush, as he is a proven threat in getting to the quarterback. Overall, the return of Joey Bosa is a welcome development for the Chargers, as they seek to continue their winning streak and maintain their position in the competitive AFC West.

paraphrase: Evan McMullin sat in a conference room in his modest campaign headquarters in Salt Lake City, brainstorming with his team about which high-profile Republican had disappointed him the most this year. paraphrase: Twenty-five years ago, at the Minneapolis Southern Theater, Gale LaJoye created Snowflake, a one-man show that showcased a down-on-his-luck clown who transformed a neglected lot into a place of wonder and magic. LaJoye is very proud of how the show turned out and received, and it remains the centerpiece of Sleeping at Last, a show that LaJoye will present at the Minneapolis Institute of Arts on Saturday. This will be the first time LaJoye has performed the show with a full cast and all the accompanying songs. Sleeping at Last was first devised in 1990 and has been performed in numerous cities, including New York, Los Angeles, and London. continuation: company announced it now expects to spend C $ 1 . 5 billion ( $ 1 . 11 billion ) on capital projects in 2015 , down from C $ 2 . 2 billion earlier . While the Senate debated a lengthy series of amendments to the proposed malpractice reform bill, the Assembly plowed ahead and pushed the plan through committee and to a vote on the floor Tuesday night.
As the Assembly convened at 9:30 p.m
continuation: . , the Senate was debating amendments to the bill . Senate President Pro Tempore Joseph I . Scutari , a Democrat from the Bronx , said the Senate would vote as shortly as the Assembly approved the bill .The bill , S . 2148 , would permit insurers to pay at least $ 10 , 000 for malpractice injuries and $ 25 , 000 for wrongful death . At 9:30 PM, the Assembly convened for a vote on the floor, while the Senate continued to deliberate on the bill. Assemblyman Richard Gottfried, a Democrat from the Bronx, emphasized the significance of the legislation in protecting consumers from unscrupulous doctors. Senate President Pro Tempore Joseph I. Scutari, a Democrat from the Bronx, confirmed that the Senate would vote on the bill once the Assembly had approved it. The bill, S. 2148, aims to increase insurers' payouts for malpractice injuries and wrongful death, with a minimum of $10,000 and $25,000, respectively. The Assembly approved the bill with a unanimous vote of 72-0, and it is expected to pass the Senate with a unanimous vote of 51-0. The bill is expected to go into effect on January 1, 2015.

paraphrase: Five Argentine tourists, including one Jewish businessman, were tragically killed in the terrorist truck-ramming attack in New York City on Tuesday afternoon. According to the Argentine foreign ministry, the victims were identified as Juan Jose Lopez and his wife, Mara de los Angeles Lopez, who were on their way to celebrate their 30th anniversary of their high school graduation. Juan Jose Lopez, 56, was a businessman from Rosario, Argentina, while his wife, Mara de los Angeles Lopez, 44, was a journalist from Rosario. The pilot of the rental truck, Sayfullo Saipov, 29, was shot and killed by authorities after he plowed into pedestrians on a bicycle path in Lower Manhattan and crashed into a truck stop. Saipov, who was born in Uzbekistan and immigrated to the United States as a baby, had been on a terrorist watchlist, according to the New York Post. Monica La Bennett, Vice-President (Operations), CDB (left) and Javier Manzanares, Executive Director ad interim (right), GCF sign the Accreditation Master Agreement.
ST GEORGES, Grenada,
continuation: July 25 , 2018 ( GLOBE NEWSWIRE ) - - The Grenada Community Foundation ( GCF ) has signed an Accreditation Master Agreement with the Caribbean Development Bank ( CDB ) to enable the GCF to be accredited as a Community Development Bank ( CDB ) . The Accreditation Master Agreement was signed by Monica La Bennett , Vice - President ( Operations ) , CDB and Javier Manzanares , Executive Director ad interim ( right ) , GCF at the GCF Headquarters in St George  s , Grenada .The Accreditation Master Agreement permits the GCF to access assistance from the CDB for the provision of financial services , notably loans , grants , and other types of financial help , through the CDB  s community development bank . The GCF is the first CDB in the Caribbean to be licensed as a Community Development Bank .The GCF is a non - profit organisation established in Grenada in 2003 . It is a not - for - profit organisation that offers monetary services to the Grenadian community .The GCF is the only CDB in the Caribbean to be licensed as a Community Development Bank . The Accreditation Master Agreement will provide the GCF to access assistance from the CDB for
paraphrase:
The Grenada Community Foundation (GCF) has reached a significant milestone by signing an Accreditation Master Agreement with the Caribbean Development Bank (CDB) to become the first Community Development Bank (CDB) in the Caribbean region. This agreement will enable the GCF to access financial assistance from the CDB, including loans, grants, and other forms of financial support, to provide critical financial services to the Grenadian community.
Monica La Bennett, Vice-President (Operations) at CDB, and Javier Manzanares, Executive Director ad interim at GCF, signed the Accreditation Master Agreement at the GCF headquarters in St. George's, Grenada. This agreement marks a significant achievement for the GCF, as it becomes the first CDB in the Caribbean to be licensed as a Community Development Bank.
The GCF was established in Grenada in 2003 as a non-profit organization, and it is committed to providing financial services to the Grenadian community. With this accreditation, the GCF can now access the CDB's extensive network and resources, which will enable it to provide even more comprehensive financial support to the community.
The Accreditation Master Agreement will allow the GCF to tap into the CDB's community development bank, providing it with the necessary resources to offer financial services to the Grenadian community. This agreement is a testament to the GCF's commitment to improving the lives of the people of Grenada through financial inclusion and community development.
The signing of the Accreditation Master Agreement is a significant step forward for the GCF, and it underscores the organization's commitment to providing high-quality financial services to the Grenadian community. With the support of the CDB, the GCF is well-positioned to continue its mission of promoting financial inclusion and community development in Grenada.

input: ST. LOUIS, MO (KTVI) - The City of St. Louis confirms three additional heat deaths, bringin the total of deaths in the city to 17. The St. Louis City Health Director is now asking the Centers for
continuation: Disease Control and Prevention to conduct an investigation into the deaths . Louis City Health Department is working with St . Louis County and St . Louis Public Health to find if there is a connection between the three fatalities .The health department is also collaborating with the Missouri Department of Health and Senior Services and the CDC to study the deaths . The health department is also working with the Missouri Department of Health and Senior Services and the CDC to study the deaths. In light of these developments, the St. Louis City Health Department is urging the public to take precautions to avoid heat-related illnesses.

Trump  s assaults on the integrity of our elections
paraphrase:
The extent of the GOP's efforts to undermine the voting rights of marginalized communities is truly alarming. On November 8th, it is crucial that these voters document and bring attention to these issues to ensure that the nation takes notice.
Donald Trump's hateful rhetoric and the turmoil it has unleashed on our society are only the tip of the iceberg. Therefore, it is imperative that we, as voters, make it clear to all Americans that we will not be intimidated by his falsehoods, discrimination, and bigotry. Moreover, we must make our voices heard by photographing our votes and sharing our experiences.
In the lead-up to Election Day, the American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU) will be launching a campaign titled "Stop the Steal" to combat voter suppression efforts in key battleground states. We urge voters to sign up and be a part of this critical effort. The ACLU will be filing lawsuits to halt these suppression tactics and ensure that everyone's voice is heard.
We have already witnessed how Trump's attacks on the integrity of our elections have made it more challenging for marginalized communities to exercise their right to vote. However, we must recognize that this is only the beginning. Trump's attacks on our democracy threaten the very foundation of our society, and it is crucial that we take action to protect our voting rights.

paraphrase:
Democratic lawmakers unveiled a comprehensive elections and ethics reform package on Friday, aimed at tackling a "culture of corruption" in Washington and reducing the influence of money in politics.
Maryland Representative Elijah Cummings, the new chair of the House Oversight and Reform Committee, emphasized in a statement that the plan will not only protect the integrity of elections but also ensure that the voices of American citizens are heard. The package proposes the establishment of an independent ethics board to investigate allegations of corruption, as well as a new Federal Election Commission to regulate political campaigns. Additionally, a new public financing system for federal elections and a requirement for all candidates to publish their tax returns would be implemented. Furthermore, a new Office of Inspector General would be established to examine charges of corruption.
This proposal is the first major legislative attempt by Democrats since the 2018 midterm elections, when they lost control of the House and became the minority party in the Senate. By creating a new independent ethics board, the bill seeks to improve the transparency and accountability of government officials. Moreover, the public financing scheme and tax return requirement would help to reduce the influence of money in politics and ensure that candidates are held accountable to the public. The establishment of an Office of Inspector General would further strengthen efforts to combat corruption and promote a culture of ethical governance.

Upon Theodosius the Great's death in 395, he bequeathed a substantial inheritance to his two immature sons, Honorius, a 10-year-old boy, and his 19-year-old brother, Theodosius II. input: The Chippewa County Department of Human Services (CCDHS) in Wisconsin works like most other government human services groups, providing child protection services, foster and respite care, elder abuse care, and more. However, they recently launched an
continuation: initiative to assist families in need . Families in Need is a project that we have been looking at for a while ,  says CCDHS Director of Community Services and Family Support , Mary Beth Wiederkehr . There are a lot of families that are struggling financially right now , and this project is designed to assist them .  Families in Need is a one - time grant of $ 1 , 000 that can be used to help pay for food , rent , utilities , childcare , and more .  We  re going to give them $ 1 , 000 to assist them with rent , utilities , food , and childcare ,  Wiederkehr stated . That  s a one - time grant , so they can  t use it again .  Wiederkehr stated the program is not a long - term
paraphrase: The Chippewa County Department of Human Services (CCDHS) in Wisconsin is similarly structured to other government agencies responsible for human services, providing protection services for children, foster care, respite care, and more. However, the organization has launched a new initiative to help families in need during the COVID-19 pandemic. The "Families in Need" program, a partnership with the Wisconsin Department of Children and Families (DCF), aims to assist families facing economic hardship. According to Mary Beth Wiederkehr, Director of Community Services and Family Support at CCDHS, the project has been in development for some time and aims to provide financial assistance to struggling families. The program offers a one-time grant of $1,000 to help cover expenses such as food, rent, utilities, childcare, and more. Wiederkehr clarified that the grant is a one-time assistance and cannot be used again. The program is not a long-term solution, but rather a temporary aid to help families get through this difficult time.

A judge ruled on Monday that the state of Massachusetts cannot sue the federal government for expanding a religious exemption to the Affordable Care Act's contraceptive mandate.
"While we are disappointed in this decision, we remain steadfast in our commitment to ensuring affordable and reliable
continuation: access to contraception for all female , " Massachusetts Attorney General Maura Healey told in a statement . " We will continue to work with our federal partners to ensure that all female have access to affordable and reliable access to contraception . "The decision , by U . S . District Court Judge Allison D . Burroughs in Boston , comes after Healey ' s office lawsuits the Trump administration last year , arguing that the administration violated the Religious Freedom Restoration Act by excluding church employers from the contraceptive mandate . The litigation was the first of its kind in the nation , and the decision means that the federal authorities will no longer be able to violate the mandate in Massachusetts .Healey ' s office asserted that the administration ' s exclusion of religious employers from the mandate violates the Religious Freedom Restoration Act , which allows religious organizations from being forced to violate their beliefs in order to obtain state benefits . " This is a major triumph for faith liberty in America , " Healey told in a statement ." The federal authorities should not be able to coerce religious organizations into violating their faith beliefs in order to obtain public benefits . " Healey ' s office is now seeking an appeal of the decision .The Obama administration had expanded the contraceptive mandate to include employers with religious objections to the birth control
paraphrase:
A federal judge has ruled that Massachusetts cannot pursue legal action against the federal government for broadening a religious exemption to the Affordable Care Act's contraceptive mandate.
While the Massachusetts Attorney General's office is disappointed in the decision, they remain committed to ensuring affordable and reliable access to contraception for all women. They vow to continue working with federal partners to ensure that all women have access to affordable and reliable contraception.
The decision, made by US District Court Judge Allison D. Burroughs in Boston, comes after the office sued the Trump administration last year, arguing that the administration violated the Religious Freedom Restoration Act by excluding church employers from the contraceptive mandate. This landmark case sets a precedent for the nation, and the ruling means that federal authorities will no longer be able to violate the mandate in Massachusetts.
The Massachusetts Attorney General's office asserts that the administration's exclusion of religious employers from the mandate violates the Religious Freedom Restoration Act, which protects religious organizations from being forced to compromise their beliefs to receive state benefits.
"This is a significant victory for religious liberty in America," Healey declared in a statement. "The federal government should not be able to coerce religious organizations into violating their beliefs to obtain public benefits."
The office is now seeking an appeal of the decision. The Obama administration had expanded the contraceptive mandate to include employers with religious objections to the birth control.

paraphrase:
ACCOMACK COUNTY, Va. - Two iconic American novels have been temporarily removed from a Virginia school district's curriculum after a parent raised objections to the use of a racial slur.
The removal of The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn and To Kill a Mockingbird from middle school textbooks in the Accomack County Public Schools was prompted by a parent's concerns. Susan McBride, the parent in question, expressed her surprise at discovering that her son's textbooks no longer included these works.
"I can't believe they would want to do that," McBride said. "I've never heard of it."
McBride found out about the books' removal from the school system's website. As a parent of four decades, she was shocked by the news.

Despite the parent's concerns, the removal of the books is only temporary, and they will likely be reinstated in the school district's curriculum after a thorough review.

input: SPRINGFIELD -- The Department of Children and Family Services began issuing layoff notices to 600 employees on Friday with the aim of paring its workforce by 375 positions while still meeting its legal obligations to care for abused and neglected children and provide other services
continuation: . The department said it will start laying off staff in the last few weeks , with the objective of reaching the objective of cutting 375 positions by the end of the year ." It ' s a challenging process , " explained DCFS Commissioner MaryEllen Elia . " We ' re not trying to eliminate jobs .We ' re not looking to cut people ' s hours . We ' re not looking to cut their pay .We ' re not looking to cut their benefits . We ' re not looking to do anything that ' s going to hurt people . "The department said it will work with affected workers to find other roles within the agency . " We ' ll be looking at every position , " Elia explained ." We ' ll be looking at every job , and we ' ll be looking at every job as an opportunity for us to develop . " Elia explained DCFS is required by legislation to provide services to all children and families who are in need ." We ' re not going to cut services , " Elia explained . " We ' re not going to reduce the number of services that we provide .We ' re not going to reduce the number of people that we serve . We ' re not going to reduce the number of children that we serve . "The
paraphrase:
The Department of Children and Family Services began notifying employees of layoffs last Friday, with the aim of reducing its workforce by 375 positions while still fulfilling its legal obligations to care for abused and neglected children and provide other essential services. The department aims to lay off staff in the coming weeks, with the goal of cutting 375 positions by the end of the year.
"It's a complex process," DCFS Commissioner MaryEllen Elia explained. "We're not looking to eliminate jobs or cut people's hours. We're not looking to reduce pay or benefits. We're not looking to do anything that will harm employees." The department said it will work with affected workers to find alternative roles within the agency.
"We'll be examining every position," Elia added. "We'll be looking at every job as an opportunity for growth and development." Despite the layoffs, the department emphasized its commitment to providing services to all children and families in need.
"We're not going to reduce the number of services we provide," Elia said. "We're not going to decrease the number of people we serve. We're not going to reduce the number of children we serve." The department acknowledged the challenges ahead but remained determined to find solutions that would minimize the impact on employees and the community.

However, I don't think this rule applies to the Browns in the same way. With an abundance of quarterbacks on their roster, the team may be forced to trade one of them in order to avoid having a backup or journeyman as their starter. It seems likely that the Browns will have to make a move to keep all of their quarterbacks, and trading one of them is the most feasible option. By doing so, they can ensure that they have a reliable starter and avoid ending up with a backup or journeyman.

input: I remember the first interview I did about the gender pay gap, back in the 90s, when women had their very own Equal Opportunities Commission. We talked about pay rates reaching parity in full-time work, then getting dragged down by part-
continuation: time work . That  s the case now , but it  s still a long way to going .Women are still paid fewer than men for the same work , on average . The newest figures from the Office for National Statistics ( ONS ) show women  s pay gap has grown to 4 . 6 per cent in 2017 / 18 , up from 4 . 1 per cent in 2016 / 17 .The ONS said the paying gap  remains to be large  , with women still receiving on average 20 per cent less than men for the same work . This is the first time the gender wages gap has grown since the ONS started measuring it in 2011 .The ONS said the increase in the paying gap was mainly owing to differences between men and female working part - time . The ONS said girls working part - time earned 1 , 000 less per decade than men employed full - time in 2017 / 18 .It said girls working part - time earned on average 1 , 300 less per year than men working full - time in 2017 / 18 . The ONS said the sex pay gap  remains to be large
paraphrase: I recall the first interview I conducted on the gender pay gap, dating back to the 1990s, when women had their own Equal Opportunities Commission. We discussed the progress made towards pay parity in full-time work, only to see it retreat with the rise of part-time work. Unfortunately, the situation has not improved much since then. Women on average still earn less than men for the same work, according to the latest figures from the Office for National Statistics (ONS). In 2017/18, the pay gap grew to 4.6% from 4.1% in the previous year, indicating that the gap remains significant. Women are paid approximately 20% less than men for the same work, which is the first increase in the pay gap since the ONS started measuring it in 2011. The ONS attributes the growth in the pay gap to differences in earnings between men and women working part-time, with women working part-time earning around 1,000 less per decade than men working full-time in 2017/18. Moreover, women working part-time earned an average of 1,300 less per year than men working full-time in the same period. The ONS emphasizes that the gender pay gap remains a significant issue, highlighting the need for continued efforts to address it.

paraphrase:
Ra Pharmaceuticals Begins Phase 2 Clinical Trial of RA101495 SC for Treatment of Generalized Myasthenia Gravis
CAMBRIDGE, Massachusetts - Ra Pharmaceuticals, Inc. (NASDAQ: RARX) has initiated a Phase 2 clinical trial of RA101495 SC, an investigational orally administered, once-daily small molecule, for the treatment of generalized myasthenia gravis (GMG). The trial will evaluate the safety and efficacy of RA101495 SC in combination with standard of care (SOC) therapies in patients with GMG who have failed to respond to current treatments.
According to David J. Cohen, M.D., Ph.D., Chief Executive Officer of Ra Pharmaceuticals, "We are excited to initiate this Phase 2 trial, which represents an important step towards determining the potential of RA101495 SC as a treatment option for patients with GMG. We believe that this investigational drug may offer a new approach to managing this rare autoimmune disorder, characterized by progressive muscle weakness, exhaustion, and fatigue-like symptoms."
GMG is a rare and debilitating autoimmune syndrome that affects the myasthenia gravis muscle, causing progressive inflammation and muscle weakness. The illness is characterized by the presence of antibodies in the blood, leading to muscle weakness and fatigue.
RA101495 SC is a novel, orally administered, once-daily small molecule that is designed to inhibit the receptor tyrosine kinase (RTK) alpha subunit of the cancer necrosis factor (TNF) receptor. The company believes that RA101495 SC may have a potential therapeutic role in treating GMG by modulating the immune system and reducing inflammation.

input:
Will John Kelly Save Trumps Soul?
There hasnt been much good to say about Trump in a long time, but recruiting Kelly suggests that he learns, very belatedly, from his mistakes, and that he
continuation: s willing to put the nation ahead of his own interests . Trump  s former chief of staff , John Kelly , is leaving the White House to become the new White House president of staff , according to the New York Times .It  s a huge deal , and it  s a huge blow to the president , who had hoped to have Kelly in place for the 2020 campaign . Kelly  s leaving is a sign that Trump has lost his grip on his party and the nation , and that he  s willing to do anything to save his own skin .Trump  s White House has been in disarray for a long time , but Trump  s own actions have been the reason of most of the problems . That  s why Kelly  s leaving is so significant .The president  s own actions have been the cause of most of the problems in the White House , but Trump  s own actions have been the cause of most of the problems in the White House , but Trump  s own actions have been the cause of most of the problems in the White House , but Trump  s own actions have been the cause of most of the problems in the White House
paraphrase:
Will John Kelly Save Trump's Presidency?
The recent news of John Kelly's departure from the White House has sparked speculation about the state of President Trump's political future. While Kelly's arrival signaled a potential shift towards a more disciplined and organized White House, his departure suggests that Trump may be losing his grip on the administration and the nation. Despite Trump's initial optimism about having Kelly in place for the 2020 campaign, Kelly's leaving is a stark reminder of the president's growing isolation and the mounting challenges he faces.
Trump's tumultuous presidency has been marked by a series of self-inflicted wounds, and Kelly's departure only adds to the growing list of problems. The president's own actions have been the root cause of many of the issues plaguing the White House, and it remains to be seen if he can regain control of the situation. As the clock ticks down to the 2020 election, Trump's prospects for a successful campaign appear increasingly uncertain.
In the end, only time will tell if John Kelly can save Trump's presidency, but one thing is certain: the road ahead will be fraught with challenges for the beleaguered administration.

No. 5 Stanford (24-5, 10-2 Pac-12) completed a three-game sweep of Washington (15-15, 5-10 Pac-12) with a 6-1 victory on Sunday.
Looking to avenge
continuation: a 1 - 0 loss to the Huskies on Jan . 10 , the Cardinal jumped out to a 2 - 0 lead in the top of the first inning . The Huskies got on the board in the bottom of the first , but Stanford answered with three runs in the top of the second to take a 4 - 1 lead .The Cardinal added two more runs in the bottom of the third to take a 5 - 1 lead . The Huskies pulled one run back in the bottom of the third , but Stanford answered with two runs in the bottom of the third to take a 6 - 1 lead .Stanford added two more runs in the bottom of the fifth to take a 7 - 1 lead . The Huskies got one run back in the bottom of the fifth , but Stanford adding two more runs in the bottom of the sixth to take a 9 - 1 lead .The Huskies getting one run back in the bottom of the sixth , but Stanford adding two more runs in the bottom of the seventh to take a 10 - 1 lead . paraphrase: Stanford dominated Washington in a three-game sweep, winning 6-1 on Sunday. Seeking revenge for their previous loss to the Huskies on January 10, the Cardinal quickly took a 2-0 lead in the top of the first inning. Washington scored in the bottom of the first, but Stanford responded with three runs in the top of the second to extend their lead to 4-1. The Cardinal added two more runs in the bottom of the third, and the Huskies managed to score only one run in response. Stanford continued to pull away, adding two more runs in the bottom of the fifth and two more in the bottom of the sixth to take an insurmountable 9-1 lead. Washington scored one more run in the bottom of the sixth, but Stanford added two more in the bottom of the seventh to seal the victory, winning 12-1.

There is a hearing today on whether presidents should be required to make their tax returns public.
Rep. Richard Neal, D-Mass., then incoming chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, addressed an audience, Nov. 27, during a gathering
continuation: of the American Israel Public Affairs Committee in Washington , D . C . ( AP Photo / J . Scott Applewhite ) WASHINGTON ( JTA )  U . S . House Ways and Means Committee Chairman Richard Neal , D - Mass . , will hold a hearing Wednesday on whether presidents should be required to make their tax returns public .Neal , who is expected to be re - elected to the post in November , will hold the hearing at 11 a . m . ET at the House headquarters building in Washington , D . C . , according to the commission  s website .The hearing comes amid a heated debate over whether President Donald Trump should be required to release his tax returns , which he has long declined to do . The House Ways and Means Committee , which Neal chairs , passed a resolution in May calling for Trump to release his tax returns .Trump has not released his tax returns since his election in November 2016 . The president has indicated he is under audit by the Internal Revenue Service , which has not answered to a proposal for comment from JTA .
paraphrase:
There will be a hearing today on whether presidential candidates should be required to make their tax returns public.
During a recent gathering of the American Israel Public Affairs Committee in Washington, D.C., Rep. Richard Neal, D-Mass., incoming chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, addressed an audience. (AP Photo/J. Scott Applewhite)
In Washington, D.C., on Wednesday, House Ways and Means Committee Chairman Richard Neal, D-Mass., will hold a hearing to consider whether presidents should be required to disclose their tax returns. Neal, who is expected to retain his position in November, will preside over the hearing at 11 a.m. ET at the House headquarters building. According to the committee's website, the hearing comes as the issue of whether President Donald Trump should release his tax returns remains a topic of debate. The House Ways and Means Committee, which Neal chairs, passed a resolution in May calling for Trump to release his tax returns. Despite his refusal to do so since his election in November 2016, Trump has indicated he is under audit by the Internal Revenue Service, which has not responded to a request for comment from JTA.

input: TAPACHULA, Mexico (AP)  Thousands of Central American migrants resumed an arduous trek toward the U.S. border Monday, with members bristling at suggestions there could be terrorists among them and saying the caravan is being used for
continuation: political purposes . Organizers of the caravan say they had reached a key point in the journey , where they expect to be able to cross into Mexico .The migrants , many of whom are from Honduras , said they had paused at a square in the southern town of Tapachula to rest after a long day of walking . They stated they would continue walking until they reached the boundary , where they would apply for asylum .ADVERTISEMENT  We are not terrorists ,  says Jesus Ramirez , a 23 - month - old migrant from San Pedro Sula , Honduras , who says he was escaping gang conflict .  We are a group of people who are fleeing violence ,  he said . We don  t want to be terrorists .  The caravan , which began in the southern Mexican town of Tapachula , is making its way north through Mexico toward the U . S . border . Mexican authorities have said the caravan will be allowed to pass through the nation if they application for asylum , but it  s uncertain how many people will do so .The caravan has been met with hostility in Mexico , where many people worry the refugees will bring
paraphrase:
Thousands of Central American migrants resumed their journey towards the US-Mexico border on Monday, with many rejecting claims that they could be harboring terrorists. According to the caravan's organizers, the group has reached a critical point in their journey and will attempt to cross into Mexico. The migrants, who hail from Honduras, stated that they had rested in a town square after a long day of walking and will continue their journey until they reach the border, where they will apply for asylum.
"We are not terrorists," asserted Jesus Ramirez, a 23-month-old migrant from San Pedro Sula, Honduras. "We are a group of people fleeing violence. We don't want to be terrorists." The caravan, which began in the southern Mexican town of Tapachula, is making its way north through Mexico towards the US border. Mexican authorities have agreed to allow the caravan to pass through the country, but it remains unclear how many individuals will apply for asylum. Despite this, the caravan has faced hostility in Mexico, with many locals worrying that the refugees could bring instability to the region.

Valejah Savon Johnson's argument with Robert Mayes resulted in Mayes clinging to the hood of Johnson's speeding pickup truck, according to affidavit.
LAFAYETTE Twenty-one-year-old Valejah Savon Johnson
continuation: , of Lafayette , was jailed Wednesday after police say he came into an disagreement with a man in a pickup truck and attempted to hit him . Johnson was indicted on accusations of aggravated assault with a lethal gun , criminal mischief and resisting arrest .Police were called to the 100 block of West Fourth Street around 6 : 45 p . m . Wednesday for an disagreement between Johnson and Robert Mayes . Police said Mayes was seated in the driver ' s seat of a pickup truck when Johnson got in the passenger seat and attempted to punch him .Johnson allegedly tried to punch Mayes three times before he getting out of the car and attempted to walk away . Mayes was able to hold onto the hood of Johnson ' s pickup truck , according to the affidavit .Police said Johnson then trying to run away , but Mayes was able to caught him . Mayes telling officers that Johnson hit him in the face with his fist , but Johnson deny that , according to the affidavit .Johnson was booked into the Lafayette Parish Correctional Center . PULGA  In December 2012, a fierce winter storm toppled five steel towers that support the same PG&E transmission line that malfunctioned minutes before the Camp Fire roared to life.
Six years later, the 115,000-volt Caribou
continuation: - to - Palo Verde transmission line that running through the Sierra Nevada highlands is already in shambles .  This is a failure of the scheme ,  PG & E  s chief executive , Bill Johnson , told a state Senate commission last week .Its not a failure of the technology.Its not a failure of the equipment.It  s not a failure of the people who work on it . It  s a failure of the system .  PG & E  s problem is that the company  s distribution networks are too old and too vulnerable to the forces of nature .The corporation  s communication connections are so old and so vulnerable to the forces of nature that the company has had to spend billions of money just to keep them run . That  s why PG & E  s communication connections have been so critical to the Camp Fire  s devastation .The blaze , which began on Nov . 8 , scorched an area the size of Los Angeles , killed 85 people and destroyed more than 18 , 000 homes . PG & E  s distribution networks are so old and so vulnerable to the forces of nature
paraphrase: In December 2012, a severe winter storm toppled five steel towers supporting a PG&E transmission line that had malfunctioned moments before the Camp Fire erupted. Six years later, the 115,000-volt Caribou-to-Palo Verde transmission line, which runs through the Sierra Nevada mountains, is in disrepair. This failure is not due to the technology, equipment, or the people who work on it, but rather the system's weaknesses. PG&E's outdated distribution networks and communication connections are too vulnerable to natural forces, requiring the company to spend billions of dollars to maintain them. This vulnerability has been highlighted by the Camp Fire, which scorched an area the size of Los Angeles, killed 85 people, and destroyed over 18,000 homes. The blaze began on November 8 and highlights the need for PG&E to address its infrastructure challenges.

One of the most significant challenges I've faced in my career is building a team. As a solo act, I've always been the one making decisions and taking the lead. However, I know that in order to scale my impact and achieve greater success, I need to learn how to effectively lead and manage a team.

Polands ruling conservative government has moved to reinstate supreme court judges it forcibly retired, acting on an injunction issued by Europes highest court.
On Wednesday the Law and Justice (PiS) party submitted the relevant legislation on
continuation: the issue to parliament . The European Court of Human Rights ( ECHR ) in Strasbourg had ruling in March that the PiS regime had broken the law by temporarily removing judges from their posts .The ECHR said the courts had been  illegally removed  and had not been given an opportunity to defend themselves . Poland  s supreme court had ordered the reinstatement of the courts , but the authorities said it would go ahead with the move anyway .The ECHR said the Polish government had failed to justify its ruling to remove the courts . The government  s move to reinstate the courts was the latest in a string of moves by the PiS regime that has raised worries in the West about the erosion of judicial sovereignty in Poland .The PiS cabinet , which arrived to power in 2015 , has also introduced a law on judicial change that it said is required to counter corruption . But critics say the law , which would eliminate some legal independence , is part of a broader move by PiS to tighten its grip on the judiciary .The European Commission , the EU  s executive arm , has advised Poland that it could face legal action over the legal improvements .
paraphrase: The Polish government, led by the conservative Law and Justice (PiS) party, has taken steps to reinstate supreme court judges that were forcibly retired in defiance of a ruling by the European Court of Human Rights (ECHR). In March, the ECHR found that the PiS regime had broken the law by temporarily removing the judges without giving them the opportunity to defend themselves. Despite this ruling, the Polish government has pressed on with its plan to reinstate the judges. This move is the latest in a series of actions by the PiS regime that have raised concerns in the West about the erosion of judicial independence in Poland. Critics argue that the PiS cabinet, which came to power in 2015, has been attempting to consolidate its control over the judiciary through a series of legal changes, including a controversial law on judicial reform. The European Commission, the EU's executive arm, has warned Poland that it could face legal action over these changes.

Security always comes down to securing applications.
The whole point of firewalls is to hide internally deployed network applicationsassumed to have exploitable vulnerabilities somewherefrom the outside world.
The main weakness of firewalls is that they are
continuation: a network security tool , not a network entry control tool . They are meant to shield the network from outside raids , not the other way around .The best method to secure applications is to secure them . This is why network access control ( NAC ) technology is so essential .Network access control software is a setting of rules and policies that govern the movement of clients and information across the network . It ' s a way to reduce malicious users from accessing vulnerable data or endpoints .NAC software is utilized in the following ways : To prohibit access to specific applications on a network . To prohibit access to specific users on a network .To limiting access to specific devices on a network . To prohibit access to specific data on a network .To limiting access to specific applications on a network . To prohibit access to specific devices on a network .To limiting access to specific data on a network . To limiting access to specific applications on a network .To limiting access to specific devices on a network . To prohibit access to specific data on a network .To limiting access to specific applications on a network . To prohibit access to specific devices on a network .To prohibit access to specific users on a network .
paraphrase:
Securing applications is the cornerstone of security, and firewalls play a crucial role in this process. The primary objective of firewalls is to protect internal network applications from external threats by hiding their vulnerabilities. However, firewalls are not a foolproof solution, as they are primarily network security tools rather than entry control tools. They are designed to safeguard the network from external attacks, not the other way around.
To ensure comprehensive application security, network access control (NAC) technology is essential. NAC software operates by establishing a set of rules and policies that regulate user and device movement across the network. This helps prevent malicious users from accessing sensitive data or endpoints. NAC software can be used in various ways, including:
Prohibiting access to specific applications on a network
Prohibiting access to specific users on a network
Limiting access to specific devices on a network
Prohibiting access to specific data on a network
Limiting access to specific applications on a network
Prohibiting access to specific devices on a network
Limiting access to specific data on a network
limiting access to specific applications on a network
limiting access to specific devices on a network
prohibiting access to specific users on a network

In summary, while firewalls provide essential protection, they should not be relied upon as the sole means of security. A comprehensive approach that incorporates NAC technology is necessary to safeguard applications and ensure overall network security.

I believe it  s important to getting this on the ballot ,  she said .  It  s
paraphrase:
Sarah Kahan, the driving force behind the effort to place a ban on circumcision on the ballot in Santa Monica, has announced that she is abandoning her push. Kahan claims that the proposed legislation has been misrepresented as an attack on religious freedom, which has led to a significant amount of confusion and opposition. A similar measure in San Diego has already failed, leaving Kahan feeling disappointed. Despite this setback, Kahan remains committed to pushing for similar legislation in other California cities, believing it to be an important cause. However, she has not yet decided whether to continue her efforts in other cities.

Despite my best efforts, the measure has been misrepresented, and I have been unable to get it on the ballot in Santa Monica. I was not aware of any other California cities that were considering similar measures, so I believe it's important to continue pushing for this. I will continue to fight for this cause, and I hope to make progress in the future."

With this information, Dynolicious can determine the ideal weight distribution for a given vehicle. The promise of Dynolicious is to provide a comprehensive measurement tool for vehicle performance, allowing users to optimize their vehicles for improved acceleration, handling, and safety.

input: ORLANDO -- Leading Republican presidential candidate Ben Carson believes that federal and state official overreacted in trying to save Terri Schiavo, a Florida woman who died in 2005 as her husband and family battled over whether to keep her alive despite her
continuation: feeding tube . In an interview with The Associated Press , the neurosurgeon and former neurosurgeon for President Barack Obama said he believes Terri Schiavo ' s death was a " tragedy " and added the federal government should have permitted the family to make the determination ." I don ' t think it was adequate for the federal government to step in , " Carson said in an interview Thursday with the AP . " I don ' t think it was proper for the state to step in .I don ' t think it was proper for the family to step in . " He also said he believes that Terri Schiavo should have been let to die on her own terms .Carson , who has been endorsed by Florida Gov . Rick Scott , said Terri Schiavo should have been let to die on her own terms ." I don ' t think that the government should have intervened , " he said . " I don ' t think the state should have intervened .I don ' t think the parents should have intervened . " Terri Schiavo , who was 31 when she died , had a feeding pipe inserted into her abdomen in the early 1990s to assist her digest food .She was placed on life support

The EBRD Literature Prize , awarded yearly by the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development ( EBRD ) , is designed to recognize the best books released in Central Asia .The competition is open to both novel and non - fiction . paraphrase:
Hamid Ismailov's EBRD Literature Prize-winning novel brings Central Asian literature to the forefront.
On the final day of 1937, 20th-century Uzbekistan's most beloved author, Abdulla Qodirov, was executed by the Soviet authorities. His influential novel "The Death of Abdulla Qodirov," published in 1940, remains a national treasure. However, it has also been a source of controversy. The EBRD Literature Prize, awarded annually by the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD), aims to recognize the best books released in Central Asia. The competition is open to both novels and non-fiction works. Hamid Ismailov's novel "A Child's Story," which was translated into English in 2014 and won the EBRD Literature Prize in 2015, tells the tale of a young child, her father, and her parents, who reside in a village in southern Uzbekistan. The girl's father, a teacher, is in love with her mother, a housewife, but he is not allowed to marry her. The girl's father is determined to find her a suitable husband, and his efforts lead him to a village in the hills, where he tries to convince the villagers to give him the girl.

A GP clinic in Edinburgh which is changing to a telephone assessment system three days a week has warned its 6,000 patients they could be turned away.
The changes at the Links Medical Centre come into force on Wednesday, May 1.
A statement
continuation: from the centre said : " As part of our ongoing attempts to reduce the number of people visiting the clinic in the future , we are introducing a telephone assessment process on a three - day a week basis . " This will provide us to easier manage the present waiting hours for patients with non - urgent appointments ." We would like to thank our patients for their patience and understanding as we make these changes . " This is a temporary measure which will be analyzed at the end of the three - day assessment phase ." We apologise for any inconvenience this might cause . " We would like to reassure our patients that we will continue to provide a complete range of health services at the Links Medical Centre . "
paraphrase: The Links Medical Centre in Edinburgh is introducing a new telephone assessment system three days a week, which may result in some patients being turned away. The change takes effect on Wednesday, May 1st. According to the centre, the new process is part of their ongoing efforts to reduce the number of people visiting the clinic in the future. By implementing a telephone assessment system, the clinic aims to improve the management of non-urgent appointments, which have been causing long waiting times. The centre apologizes for any inconvenience this may cause and assures patients that they will continue to provide a comprehensive range of health services.

paraphrase:
There seems to be a lot of confusion surrounding cloud computing, with many people struggling to understand its true nature and potential applications. In response, various groups have emerged, claiming to provide clarity and guidance on this complex topic. One such organization is the Cloud Computing Foundation (CCF), which was established in February by a coalition of IT professionals, developers, and consultants. The CCF's primary objective is to promote cloud computing in the enterprise sector, and it has undertaken several initiatives to achieve this goal.
One of the most notable of these initiatives is the CCF's Cloud Computing Certification Program (CCCP), which aims to educate individuals about the ins and outs of cloud networking and its potential in the enterprise environment. The CCCP is based on the CCF's own Cloud Computing Certification Program (CCCP), which was introduced in February and has since gained widespread recognition. The CCF's ultimate goal is to propagate cloud computing in the enterprise space, and it has launched various projects to achieve this aim.
In summary, cloud computing remains a mystery to many, but organizations like the CCF are working tirelessly to change that. By providing certification programs and other initiatives, these groups are helping individuals and organizations understand the power of cloud computing and its potential to transform the way we work and live.

paraphrase:
The new TRENDnet TEW-809UB AC1900 wireless USB adapter is put to the test. Is it worth adding to your shopping list? Let's find out.
Traditionally, AC1900 adapters were limited to the PCIe interface due to the fact that the USB 2.0 interface was too slow to keep up with the information rates of the PCIe interface. However, with the advancement of PCIe 3.0, PCIe 3.0 x16, and PCIe 3.0 x4, the PCI Express interface has become a viable option for AC1900 adapters. PCIe 3.0 x16 and PCIe 3.0 x4 are capable of exchanging data at speeds of up to 2.5 Gbps, while the new PCIe 3.0 x4 interface can reach speeds of up to 10 Gbps. In addition to the PCIe 3.0 x16 and PCIe 3.0 x4 interfaces, the TRENDnet TEW-809UB AC1900 wireless USB adapter also supports PCIe 3.0 x8, PCIe 3.0 x4, and PCIe 3.0 x4 x16. paraphrase:
Sam Bush, a renowned figure in the roots music scene, has long been hailed as a pioneer in the genre known as "newgrass." With a successful solo career and stints as a sideman for the likes of Emmylou Harris, Lyle Lovett, and B.B. King, Bush has established himself as a respected artist and a true master of his craft.
His latest solo album, "The Other Side," is a celebration of Bush's roots and the music of his home state of Colorado. The follow-up to his critically acclaimed 2012 album of the same name, "The Other Side" marks the first newgrass album release since 2005's "The Other Side II" and Bush's first solo album since his collaboration with Emmylou Harris on the aforementioned album.
Recorded with a host of talented Colorado musicians, including keyboardist John Leger, drummer Chris Knechtel, and drummer Mike McEwan, the album also features a special guest appearance by Grammy Award-nominated singer and songwriter Emmylou Harris.
The album will be released on September 21, 2014, on Bush's own record imprint, Sam Bush Records. In addition to the standard album, a deluxe version with a bonus DVD featuring live shows and more will also be available. Fans can pre-order the album now at sambushrecords.com.

Sam Bush is a highly respected musician known for his work in the genre of newgrass. With a career spanning several decades, Bush has established himself as a pioneer in the roots music scene, and his latest album, "The Other Side," is a testament to his enduring talent and dedication to his craft.

How David Bowie helped my autistic son become himself.
When my son Benj was a small boy of 4 and 5 with virtually no original language and no ability or desire to play in conventional ways, he and I connected through music. I
continuation: d take him to see David Bowie at the Royal Albert Hall in London , where he would view the musicians and watch the audience . I  d sing him Bowie  s music , and he  d sing along .I would watch the musicians and watch the audience . I would watch the musicians and watch the audience .He and I would sing along . He and I would sing along .He and I would sing along . He and I would sing along .He and I would sing
paraphrase:
David Bowie's impact on my son's self-discovery was nothing short of transformative. As a small child aged 4 and 5, Benj had limited language skills and showed little interest in conventional play. However, through music, we formed a deep connection. I took him to witness David Bowie's performances at the Royal Albert Hall in London, where he marveled at the musicians and observers. I sang him Bowie's songs, and he joyfully sang along. Together, we watched the musicians and the audience, and our shared love for the music helped him find his voice.
Through Bowie's music, my son discovered a world beyond his limits, and his confidence grew as he began to express himself more openly. The songs became his anthem, inspiring him to embrace his uniqueness and find his true self. Bowie's artistry taught Benj that there is beauty in being different, and he learned to celebrate his individuality.
In the end, David Bowie's music not only helped my son find himself but also gave him a sense of belonging in a world that often marginalizes those who are different. His legacy lives on through the countless individuals he touched, including my son, and his impact will continue to inspire generations to come.

Future historians will probably refer to the first quarter of the 21st century as the Bike Age. Bikes are everywhere  and theres no escaping them.
No one denies that theyre a good idea in terms of reducing pollution
continuation: and improving health.But whats the long-term impact?A new study from the University of Pennsylvania  s Wharton School , published in the journal Transportation Research , suggests that the popularity of cyclists has led to an increase in traffic congestion and pollution .  Our findings show that the rise of bicycling in the U . S . is associated with an increase in congestion and pollution ,  says Penn associate professor of transportation policy and management , Daniel J . Schulman . We  ve already shown that folks are riding bicycles to work and school , and that  s a good thing ,  Schulman said .  But it  s also producing more traffic congestion and pollution .  The survey ,  Bicycle - Driven Congestion and Air Pollution in the U . S . ,  discovered that bikes commuting is associated with an increase in traffic congestion and pollution .Overall , the study found that cyclist commuting is associated with an increase in traffic congestion and pollution .  Our findings show that the rise of bicycling in the U . S . is associated with an increase in congestion and pollution ,
paraphrase: Future historians may view the first quarter of the 21st century as the Bicycle Era. Bicycles are ubiquitous, and it is difficult to escape them. While many acknowledge their benefits in reducing pollution and improving health, a recent study from the University of Pennsylvania's Wharton School, published in Transportation Research, raises concerns about the long-term consequences of the surge in cycling. According to the study, the popularity of cycling in the US has led to increased traffic congestion and pollution. "Our findings suggest that the rise of cycling in the US is associated with increased congestion and pollution," said Daniel J. Schulman, associate professor of transportation policy and management at Penn. While the study acknowledges the benefits of cycling to work and school, it highlights the growing challenge of managing increased traffic and pollution. The survey, "Bicycle-Driven Congestion and Air Pollution in the US," found that commuting by bike is linked to higher levels of traffic congestion and pollution. Overall, the study suggests that the growth of cycling in the US is linked to increased congestion and pollution.

input:
Taxpayers are handing businesses 93bn a year  a transfer of more than 3,500 from each household in the UK.
The total emerges from the first comprehensive account of what Britons give away to companies in grants, subsidies and tax breaks
continuation: . The Office for National Statistics ( ONS ) says the figures are the first to indicate how many money is being given away by the Government to companies .In a sign of the scale of the transfer , the ONS determined that firms received 93bn in tax breaks , grants and subsidies in the year to March 2015 . The total is more than 3 , 500 from each family in the UK .It coming as the Government faces growing pressure to explain the scale of the transfer from the public purse . The ONS estimates indicate that firms received 93bn in tax breaks , grants and subsidies in the year to March 2015 ( Picture : ONS ) The Government has been accused of taking away more than 3 , 500 from each family in the UK ( Picture : ONS ) The ONS said the figures are the first to show how many money is being sent away by the Government to companies ( Picture : ONS ) The ONS said the figures are the first to indicate how many money is being sent away by the Government to companies ( Picture : ONS ) It comes as the Chancellor , George Osborne , is due to facing challenges from MPs on the Treasury Select Committee about the scale of the transfer
paraphrase: Taxpayers are shelling out a whopping 93 billion annually to businesses, translating to over 3,500 pounds from each household in the UK. This revelation emerges from the first comprehensive analysis of the amount of money the government is giving away to companies through grants, subsidies, and tax breaks. The Office for National Statistics (ONS) discovered that firms received a staggering 93 billion in tax breaks, grants, and subsidies in the year ending March 2015, highlighting the enormity of the transfer from the public purse. This translates to over 3,500 pounds from each family in the UK. As the government faces mounting scrutiny over the scale of this transfer, the ONS's findings underscore the urgent need for greater transparency and accountability. The Chancellor, George Osborne, is set to face questions from MPs on the Treasury Select Committee regarding the magnitude of this transfer.

A video from conservative activist James O'Keefe sparked this most recent effort to strip NPR of public funding.
Washington (CNN) -- The House of Representatives passed legislation Thursday that would bar federal funding for National Public Radio -- a longtime target of conservatives irritated
continuation: by the channel ' s liberal bias . The bill , introduced by Republican Rep . Steve King of Iowa , would bar federal money for any group that " engages in any activity that supports or advocates the overthrow of the United States government . "The bill is unlikely to pass the Senate , where Democrats hold a slim majority . NPR has long been a target of conservatives who argue that the channel is too liberal and biased .In the past , the channel has been targeted for defunding , notably in 2009 , when then - Rep . Michele Bachmann , R - Minnesota , launched a legislation that would have stripped the channel of its taxation - exempt designation . The House bill is the latest initiative to strip NPR of public funding .Earlier this year , the House passed a legislation that would have stripped the network of its taxation - exempt designation . The bill was introduced by Rep . Steve King , R - Iowa , but it was killed in the Senate after the Obama administration threatened to veto it .The House version of the bill would have banned federal money for any group that " engages in any activity that supports or advocates the overthrow of the United States government . " The bill would also have barred
paraphrase: A recent video from conservative activist James O'Keefe has ignited renewed efforts to strip NPR of public funding. According to CNN, the House of Representatives passed legislation Thursday that would prohibit federal funding for National Public Radio due to its perceived liberal bias. The bill, introduced by Republican Rep. Steve King of Iowa, aims to bar federal money for any organization that engages in activities that support or advocate for the overthrow of the United States government. The legislation is unlikely to pass the Senate, where Democrats hold a slim majority. NPR has long been a target of conservatives who argue that the channel leans too far to the left. In the past, the channel has faced attempts to defund it, including in 2009 when then-Rep. Michele Bachmann of Minnesota introduced a bill that would have stripped NPR of its tax-exempt designation. This latest effort to defund NPR comes after the House passed a similar bill earlier this year, but it was killed in the Senate after the Obama administration threatened to veto it. The House version of the bill would have banned federal funding for any organization that engages in activities that support or advocate for the overthrow of the United States government, in addition to barring tax-exempt status for those groups.
